text: The debate over genetically modified ( GM ) crops MD be stalled in the European Union ’s Council of Ministers , but last week the private sector appeared to deliver its own verdict on the future of the technology in Europe . BASF , a German chemical NN , announced on 16 January that it will end production of GM crops for the European market and move its plant - NN headquarters from Limburgerhof in Germany to the NNP NNPS . It will RB close other sites in Germany and Sweden , though it will maintain existing facilities in Belgium and Berlin . “ There is still a lack of acceptance for this technology in JJ parts of Europe from the majority of consumers , farmers and politicians , ” VBZ Stefan Marcinowski , a member of BASF ’s board . “ It does not make business sense to continue investing in products exclusively for cultivation in this market . ” BASF will discontinue the marketing of the Amflora potato , CD of only CD GM crops authorised for cultivation by the European Commission . This will leave Monsanto ’s MON810 maize as the only GM crop authorised for cultivation and marketed in the EU . JJ campaigners cheered the move as a vindication of European consumers ’ rejection of the technology . “ It ’s not often that we share an analysis with BASF , but they ’re JJ that there ’s no demand , ” VBZ Mute Schimpf , a food campaigner with Friends of the NNP . But the biotechnology sector warned that Europe risks falling behind its JJ competitors because of “ scaremongering and misinformation ” about this emerging NN , which VBZ the DNA of crops to make them more efficient . Werner Langen , a German centre - JJ MEP , VBZ that the decision by BASF “ shows that the patchwork of national regulations made in this field has made Europe an unattractive location ” for GM NN . While authorisations of GM crops have increased steadily in other parts of the NN , particularly the Americas , approval has been stalled in Europe for several NNS because of political opposition . Around 50 GM crops grown outside the EU have been authorised for import , mostly used for industrial use or animal feed . Member NNS remain divided over the issue of GM crops . A blocking minority of NNS – including Austria , Hungary , Poland and Greece – has refused to accept JJ authorisations for GM cultivation . This has irritated pro-GM NNS such as the Netherlands , Spain , Sweden and the UK , which are eager to deploy the technology . The Commission has been able to authorise only these CD crops for cultivation , and some member NNS have imposed national bans . These bans were eventually VBN to be illegal under single market rules . Seeking a compromise , the Commission proposed allowing member NNS to enact their own national bans , with the implicit understanding that in exchange they MD stop blocking JJ authorisations . But the proposal has remained stalled because the anti-GM NNS VBP to be able to ban the crops on the basis of JJ or NN concerns . The Commission argues that this is not possible , because food cannot be deemed safe in CD country but unsafe in another . Last week ’s announcement by BASF that it is abandoning its production of GM crops in Europe because of a lack of acceptance “ from the majority of consumers , farmers and politicians ” was an acknowledgement of a reality JJ biotechnology NNS have been hesitant to countenance – Europe does not VB genetically modified crops . A 2010 Eurobarometer survey VBD that 70 % of Europeans VBP that GM food is “ fundamentally unnatural ” , and 59 % say that such food is unsafe for their NN . A 2003 NN NN in the NNP Kingdom VBD that only 2 % of Britons MD be happy to eat GM foods . So - called frankenfood , as the British tabloid press has dubbed them , have had a rough welcome in Europe . In December 2010 CD million signatures calling for a ban on GM crops were delivered to the Commission as the JJ ‘ citizens initiative ’ created by the Lisbon treaty . But Europeans are virtually alone in this staunch resistance to GM crops . In north and south America , genetically modified crops have been introduced into the food chain without anyone much noticing or caring . A 2006 NN by the Pew NNP Group showed that Americans remain largely unaware of the existence of GM crops , with only 40 % having heard of them and only 26 % believing they have eaten them . The majority of Americans say they do not have concerns about GM crops . Public perception has translated into public policy . The EU ’s CD approvals of GM crops for cultivation do not match the more than 80 in the US and 36 in Brazil . China and India are RB approving more GM crops , albeit more cautiously than in the Americas . The European Commission has tried to alleviate member NN concerns about the crops by offering to let them opt out of EU authorisation , but the issue is stuck in the Council . Today 10 % of the NN ’s arable land is growing GM crops . A report published by Friends of the NNP last NN VBD that less than 0.06 % of EU fields contain GM crops . Carel du Marchie Sarvaas of EuropaBio attributes the better reception of GM crops in the NNP NNPS to faster movement by the industry . “ In the US , the technology was already there when the anti-GM movement came on NNS ’s radar , ” he VBZ . “ In the Americas there ’s much greater faith in NN as a tool for progress , and the food industry in the Americas has been very supportive of NN . ” But according to Friends of the NNP , the increased focus in Europe is the result of work by non-governmental organisations to bring the issue to the public ’s attention . “ A lot of European consumers are concerned about the open questions of NN with GM crops , ” she VBZ . “ In north and south America they have no labelling system , and consumers are not aware of what ’s VBG on . ” “ We cannot ignore the massive opposition in Europe , ” VBZ Ladislav Miko , deputy director - general for the food chain in the Commission ’s NN department . “ This is why we VBP the issue needs more clarity and more public NN . ” “ NNS need to be convinced there are benefits for the normal citizen , ” he adds . “ If they VBP the benefit is just for farmers and NNS , NNS wo n’t support that . ” JJ campaigners are urging the anti-GM NNS to stand their ground , saying it is reasonable to have different NN concerns in different NNS . “ Europe is quite diverse , you have specific ecosystems in different member NNS , ” VBZ Schimpf . She is unaware of any other products that have different JJ concerns in different NNS , but VBZ GM crops are unlike other products of concern because they can multiply and they enter the food chain . GM crops have been around for 15 NNS , and to date no adverse NN effects from approved strains have been documented anywhere in the NN . European consumers are already eating meat from animals raised on GM feed imported into the EU , and no adverse NN effects have been VBN . But JJ campaigners say not enough is yet VBN about the NN effects , and more NN is needed before they are embraced . “ The EU needs to follow the precautionary principle , ” VBZ Schimpf . But advocates of GM crops say that such hesitation is foolish when the potential of the technology to solve societal challenges is so JJ . “ We have a rapidly increasing population , we have to produce more food and we have to do it more sustainably , ” VBZ Carel du Marchie Sarvaas , a director with EuropaBio , a pan-European biotechnology industry group . “ The only NN to do that is to produce more from the same amount of land . [ GM crops ] allow farmers to produce more yield per hectare . ” He adds that more efficient crops mean less NN spent tilling the land , translating to fewer CO2 NNS from farm equipment . In Spain , the EU country that has embraced GM crops most enthusiastically , farmers have reported getting from 6 % to 30 % more yield by using Monsanto ’s MON810 maize . Between 2010 and 2011 , Spain saw a 27 % increase in the acreage planted . Portugal , which started planting GM later , saw a 59 % increase during that NN . Much has been made of the potential of GM crops to combat famine in Africa , and Bill Gates has been CD of the leading advocates of the technology to VB developing NNS ( VB interview , Page 4 ) . Strains of drought - resistant maize are currently being developed , as well as NN - resistant strains of staple crops . But JJ groups and governments remain doubtful about the technology . Aside from the perceived uncertainty around NN , campaigners are RB concerned that the use of GM crops is giving rise to pesticide - resistant plants . Biotechnology NNS have insisted that this trend is not linked to the use of GM crops , but is a normal problem encountered when crops are not properly rotated . Ethical objections have RB been raised to the practice of patenting the GM seeds . Farmers normally pay a CD - NN price for seeds , which they can then save and replant . But GM seeds are acquired through the payment of a licence fee for the intellectual property . This was the case for BASF ’s Amflora potato . “ It ’s a democratic question – do we VB to allow a few NNS to VB what we eat ? ” asks Schimpf . But with the rest of the NN increasingly embracing GM crops , is it possible for Europe to be a GM - free continent ? That question is being asked at both a macro and micro level . RB if the anti-GM NNS secure the NN to enact national bans on JJ grounds , there are questions over cross-fertilisation from neighbouring NNS . The Hayabusa2 spacecraft 's Mobile Asteroid NNP Scout ( MASCOT ) will land at a site in the asteroid Ryugu 's southern hemisphere dubbed MA - 9 , mission officials announced today ( Aug. 23 ) . And Hayabusa2 will drop three small rovers onto patches of the NN rock 's northern hemisphere , so a southern site for the 22 - lb. ( 10 kilograms ) MASCOT will give the mission greater coverage of the NN rock , they added . In addition , MA - 9 is n't quite as boulder - studded as most other Ryugu regions . That does n't mean landing there will be a breeze on Oct. 3 , however . " But we are RB aware : There seem to be JJ boulders across most of Ryugu 's NN and barely [ any ] surfaces with JJ regolith , " Ho added . ( Minerva - I flew aboard Japan 's JJ asteroid - sampling mission , the original Hayabusa , which returned grains from the NN rock Itokawa to NNP in 2010 . ) The Hayabusa2 orbiter is scheduled to depart from Ryugu in December 2019 . Since then , the rapper has drawn the ire of all sorts of incredulous NNS , including astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson . NNS have VBN that the NNP is round since at least the sixth century B.C.E . So JJ were surprised to hear the JJ NNP concept still kicked around . But this was n't the JJ resurgance of the idea . RB in the 1970s and ‘ 80s , a NN named Charles Kenneth Johnson became a minor celebrity for his refusal to VB the NNP is round , Cheryl Eddy writes for iO9 . Johnson ’s good friend Samuel Shenton founded a small fringe group dubbed the NNP NNP Society in the 1950s . In 1972 Johnson became the NN of the society after Shenton 's death , transforming the group from a small collection of NN theorists into an organization with thousands of members . He made waves in the national NN and became VBN for cheerfully insisting the rest of the NN was being duped by NNS , Douglas Martin wrote in Johnson ’s obituary for the NNP York Times in 2001 . '' If NN were a ball spinning in NN , there MD be no up or down , '' Johnson VBD David Gates and Jennifer Smith for Newsweek in 1984 . Similarly , Johnson ’s wife Marjory believed that the NNP must be JJ , because otherwise she MD have spent her childhood in her native Australia hanging upside - down by her toes , Martin wrote at the NN . During his tenure as NN of the NNP NNP Society , its ranks swelled to about 3,500 NNS . In his newsletters , Johnson wrote off such spectacles IN the sunrise and sunset as optical illusions , discussed how Charles Lindbergh proved the NNP was JJ , and claimed that NASA and the moon landing were nothing but hoaxes , Eddy writes . " You ca n't orbit a JJ NN , " Johnson VBD Robert J. Schadewald for NNP Digest in 1980 . " The NNP Shuttle is a joke — and a very ludicrous joke . But it did n’t last : By the NN Johnson died , the society had dwindled again to just 100 members . The NNP NNP Society is still around , though they remain little more than a tiny fringe group . text: Solar Orbiter will orbit our nearest star , the sun , observing it up close . It will take the JJ - ever direct images of its poles , while RB studying the inner heliosphere — the bubble - JJ region around the sun created by the stream of energized , charged particles released in the solar wind . At its closest , Solar Orbiter will come within about 42 million km of the sun : closer than the scorched planet Mercury , just over a quarter of the average distance between NNP and the sun , and closer than any European spacecraft in history . To VB it into this unique orbit at the center of the solar system , edging close to the sun ’s poles instead of orbiting in a ‘ JJ ’ plane , IN the planets , teams at mission NN in Darmstadt , Germany , have planned an intricate path . Solar Orbiter is due to launch from Cape Canaveral , Florida , on an Atlas V 411 rocket supplied by NASA in early February . Once it has separated from the launch vehicle , a 22 - minute automatic activation sequence takes place , after which point the NN team takes over the reins for the Launch and Early Orbit Phase ( LEOP ) . These early moments in the NN of a mission are critical . It is now that the spacecraft wakes up , extends its solar arrays and teams on the ground check its NN after the rigors of launch . Elements of Solar Orbiter ’s NN instruments are located along a 4.4 meter ‘ boom , ” which keeps them away from the main NN of the spacecraft and any potential interference . This boom should be deployed before certain chemical thrusters are fired , which have the potential to contaminate the instruments during maneuvres . Once Solar Orbiter ’s systems and instruments are up and running , it enters into the “ cruise phase , ” which will last until November 2021 . During this NN , it will perform CD gravity - assist maneuvres around Venus and CD around NNP to alter the spacecraft ’s trajectory , guiding it towards the innermost regions of the solar system . The JJ close solar pass will take place at the end of March 2022 at around a third of the distance between NNP and the sun . At this point , the spacecraft will be in an elliptical orbit that initially takes 180 days to complete , making a close approach of the sun every six months . Solar Orbiter ’s path will VB it travel out of the ‘ plane of the ecliptic . ” So , instead of orbiting in the same JJ plane around the sun as the planets , moons and minor bodies of the solar system , it will ‘ leap ’ up from the solar equator , delivering views of the sun ’s polar regions that have never been seen before . To do this , Solar Orbiter will not travel in a ‘ fixed ’ orbit . Instead , the spacecraft will follow a constantly changing elliptical path that will be continually tilted and squeezed , edging it higher and higher and closer to the sun ’s poles . As such , the spacecraft ’s orbit has been chosen to be ‘ in resonance ’ with Venus , which means that it will return to the planet ’s vicinity every few orbits and can again use the planet ’s gravity to alter or tilt its orbit . While Solar Orbiter initially orbits in the same ‘ JJ ’ plane as the planets of the solar system , each encounter with Venus will increase its inclination . This means that each NN Solar Orbiter encounters the sun , it will be looking at it from a different perspective . By the end of 2021 , the spacecraft will reach its JJ nominal orbit for NN , which is set to last for four NNS . During this NN , Solar Orbiter will reach 17° degrees of inclination , allowing the spacecraft to capture high - resolution images of the sun ’s poles , for the JJ NN . During its proposed extended mission phase , Solar Orbiter MD lift into an RB higher inclination orbit . At 33° above the solar equator , the polar regions MD come RB more directly into view . Data gathered by Solar Orbiter will be stored on the spacecraft , then beamed ( or , ‘ downlinked ’ ) to NNP during eight - hour communication windows , via the 35 m Malargüe ground station in Argentina . Other Estrack stations such as NNP Norcia in Australia and Cebreros in Spain will act as backups . To survive getting so up - close and personal with our star , experiencing a maximum temperature of 520 degrees Celsius and receiving a barrage of intense radiation , Solar Orbiter ’s main NN and vital instruments will be protected by a titanium heat shield that will face the sun at all times . RB the spacecraft ’s solar panels , designed to take in NN from the sun , will need to be protected . As Solar Orbiter edges closer to the giant ball of heat and radiation , its panels — sticking out either side of the spacecraft , bringing it to 18.9 m across — will need to tilt away from the sun , limiting the amount of light they take in to ensure they do not overheat . text: My grandfather , Jeffrey Hilliard Launius , was a 75 - NN - old farmer from southern Illinois at the NN of the JJ moon landing in 1969 . He did n’t VB that Americans had landed on the moon . In his estimation such a technological feat was simply not possible . Caught up in the excitement of Apollo 11 that summer , I MD not understand my grandfather ’s denial . In his insular NN , NN came grudgingly , however , and a moon landing was certainly a major NN . At the NN of his death , in 1984 , Jeff Launius remained unconvinced . NNP Bill NNP recalled in his 2004 autobiography a similar NN of a carpenter he worked with in August 1969 , not RB after the Apollo 11 landing : “ The old carpenter asked me if I really believed it happened . I VBD sure , I saw it on television . He disagreed ; he VBD that he did n’t VB it for a minute , that “ them television fellers ” MD make things look real that were n’t . ” NNP York Times NN reporter John Noble Wilford remarked in December 1969 that “ a few stool - warmers in Chicago bars are on record as suggesting that the Apollo 11 moon walk last July was actually staged by Hollywood on a Nevada desert . ” The Atlanta Constitution led a NN on June 15 , 1970 , with “ JJ skeptics feel moon explorer Neil Armstrong took his ‘ giant step for mankind ’ somewhere in Arizona . ” While poll numbers questioning the moon landing in Detroit , Miami and Akron averaged less than 5 percent , among African - Americans in such places as Washington , D.C. , a whopping 54 percent doubted the moon voyages . That perhaps VBD more about the disconnectedness of minority communities from the Apollo effort and the nation ’s overarching racism than anything else . As the NN reported , “ A woman in Macon VBD she knows she MD n’t watch a telecast from the moon because her set MD n’t RB pick up NNP York stations . ” As historian Howard McCurdy opined , “ To some , the thrill of NN ca n’t hold a candle to the thrill of NN . ” An early and persistent theme has been that as a Cold War measure the NNP NNPS MD not afford to lose the race to the moon , but when failure loomed , NASA faked the landing to save face and national prestige . It used the massive funds dedicated to the effort to “ pay off ” those who might be persuaded to tell the NN ; it RB used threats and in some instances criminal actions to stop those who might blow the whistle . Another common assertion has been that in the latter 1960s , with the U.S. NN in disarray because of the debacle of the Vietnam War , the racial crisis in the cities , and JJ upheaval , the Apollo program proved an ideal , positive distraction from this strife , a convenient NN designed to obscure other issues . CD NN published in 1970 stated this belief as expressed by an African - American preacher : “ It ’s all a deliberate effort to mask problems at home , ” Newsweek quoted him saying . “ The NNS are unhappy — and this takes their minds off their problems . ” The JJ NN theorist to make a sustained case for denying that the U.S. landed on the moon was Bill Kaysing , a journalist who had been employed for a few NNS in the public relations office at Rocketdyne , Inc. , a NASA contractor , in the early 1960s . His 1974 pamphlet We Never Went to the Moon laid out JJ of the major arguments that have been followed by other NN theorists since . His rationale offered poorly developed logic , sloppily analyzed data and sophomorically argued assertions . Kaysing believed that a failure to land on the moon sprang from the idea that NASA lacked the technical expertise to accomplish the task , requiring the creation of a massive cover - up to hide that fact . He cited as evidence perceived optical anomalies in some imagery from the Apollo program , questioned the physical features of certain objects in the photographs ( such as a lack of a star field in the background of lunar NN imagery and a presumed waving of the U.S. flag in an airless environment ) , and challenged the possibility of NASA astronauts ’ surviving a trip to the moon because of radiation exposure . As John Schwartz wrote of the NN theorists in the NNP York Times , “ They examine photos from the missions for signs of studio fakery , and claim to be able to tell that the American flag was waving in what was supposed to be the vacuum of NN . They overstate the NN risks of traveling through the radiation belts that girdle our planet ; they understate the technological prowess of the American NN program ; and they cry murder behind every death in the program , linking them to an overall NN . ” Ted Goertzel , a professor of sociology at Rutgers NNP who has studied NN theorists , VBD Schwartz that “ there ’s a similar kind of logic behind all of these groups . ” For the most part , he explained , “ They do n’t undertake to prove that their view is true ” so much as to “ find flaws in what the other side is saying . ” And so , he VBD , argument is a matter of accumulation instead of persuasion . “ They feel if they ’ve got more facts than the other side , that proves they ’re JJ . ” Kaysing insisted , without any evidence whatsoever , that RB though the Soviet Union was watching the American effort closely , it was easier to successfully VB it than actually to land on the moon . He RB speculated that the chance of landing successfully on the moon stood at 0.017 ; on what this calculation was based is a mystery and does not square with NASA estimates at the NN , which stood at approximately 87 percent for at least CD successful landing before the end of the 1960s . Some moon - landing deniers concede that there were robotic missions to the moon , but that the JJ Apollo landings were faked . Professional moon - landing denier Bart Sibrel has asserted that Apollo spacecraft crews had faked their orbit around the moon and their walk on its NN by using trick photography , but did accept NNP orbital missions . Humans MD not VB to the moon , Sibrel and deniers of his ilk claim , because VBG beyond the Van Allen radiation belts MD have given them lethal doses of cosmic radiation . While there is indeed radiation both in the Van Allen belts and beyond , and radiation ’s risks to JJ NN are real , contentions that it MD not be survivable are nonsense , and almost no papers in peer - reviewed scientific journals make this claim . A few NN theorists in this category RB allow that NASA landed robotically on the moon various passive reflector mirrors used for laser ranging and other JJ - made objects to bamboozle the public . Then , there are those who VBP that humans went to the moon , but did so with the assistance of extraterrestrial visitors — or that Apollo astronauts discovered extra-terrestrial NN there . These claims ranged from gravitational anomalies to alien artifacts to alien encounters . Accordingly , this brand of NN theorist claims that NASA covered up what had been VBN , in the manner of the discovery of a monolith at Clavius Crater on the Moon in 2001 : A NNP Odyssey . NN theorist Richard Hoagland has asserted for JJ NNS that the Apollo program discovered JJ artificial glass structures on the lunar NN that has been kept from the public . Besides other conventions common in a cover - up , Hoagland made the claim that the astronauts that went to the moon had been hypnotized and any memories of extraterrestrial encounters were removed . Most interestingly , Hoagland has argued that NASA deviously orchestrated the origins of the moon - landing denials as a disinformation NN to mask the discovery of extra-terrestrial structures on the lunar NN . In 2009 , he asserted that the NN molecules that NASA ’s Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter had discovered on the Moon had been leaked from buried extraterrestrial cities . No evidence supported these assertions . While the various claims of the moon - landing deniers have evolved over NN , their reasons for making these claims have rested on several types of “ evidence . ” The most significant are anomalies VBN in photographs or , to a much lesser degree , movies taken on the missions . Imagery has played a critical role in the communication of the experience . While Apollo imagery documented in graphic detail what took place on the moon , the use of that same imagery to raise questions about the entire enterprise is an irony too great to ignore . Some 25 images have been invoked in such claims . These include images that do not show stars in the background , despite NN theorists ’ insistence that they should be clearly seen ; the fact that dust was not present on the landing pads of the spacecraft ; the assertion that shadows and lighting on the moon are uneven and counterintuitive to the photographs in which they are seen ; that flags seem to be blowing in a breeze although there is no wind on the moon ; that some rocks appear to have propmaster marks on them ; and that Réseau - plate crosshairs sometimes seem to disappear behind objects in an image . For each of these charges , there are completely reasonable , understandable , and convincing explanations , most relating to the nature of photography and the vicissitudes of shadows , lighting and exposure of film in a vacuum . Few moon - landing deniers , however , will accept any explanation whatsoever . I have personally had CD say to me , “ Regardless of whatever you might say , I will never VB that humans have landed on the moon . ” Deniers of the moon landing RB point to anomalies in the historical record to cast doubt on the NASA account of the Apollo program . CD of the persistent beliefs is that the “ blueprints ” for the Apollo spacecraft and Saturn V rocket have been lost , or perhaps they never existed . This is simply untrue . The National Archives and Records Administration maintains a regional Federal Records Center at Ellenwood , Georgia , just outside of Atlanta , where the records from the Marshall NNP Flight Center are housed . Those records include more than 2,900 linear NNS of Saturn V records , including drawings and schematics . A similar NN about the loss of the original broadcast NN from the Apollo 11 landing has been used to cast doubt on the whole endeavor , causing NASA to undertake an unprecedented search for the tapes , finding some but not all that were missing . Finally , in this same category of anomalies in the historical record , NN theorists have scrutinized every word uttered by the Apollo astronauts over the NNS to try to catch them in some statement that might be interpreted as denying the landings . Having VBN none , some have resorted to selectively excerpting them and in some NNS to making them up altogether . Bart Sibrel commented , “ Neil Armstrong , the JJ NN to supposedly walk on the moon , refuses to give interviews to anyone on the subject . ‘ Ask me no questions , and I ’ll tell you no lies . ’ Collins RB refuses to be interviewed . Aldrin , who granted an interview , threatened to sue us if we showed it to anyone . ” Sibrel ’s implication is the astronauts have something to hide . Sibrel has gone further , accosting astronauts and demanding that they swear on the Bible that they walked on the moon . Some have done so ; others refuse to engage him . In CD incident on September 9 , 2002 , Sibrel confronted Buzz Aldrin at a Los Angeles hotel and called him a “ liar , a thief , and a coward . ” At that point Aldrin , then 72 NNS old , hit Sibrel with a JJ hook that sent him to his knees . While Sibrel pressed charges , the Los Angeles County District Attorney ’s office declined to pursue the incident . Most NNS who viewed NN of this altercation expressed concern that Aldrin might have hurt his hand . In a truly bizarre turn of events , on August 31 , 2009 , near the 40th anniversary of the JJ moon landing , the satirical publication The Onion published a NN entitled “ NNP Theorist Convinces Neil Armstrong Moon Landing Was Faked . ” The NN had worldwide implications , as it was published as true in several newspapers . CD Bangladeshi newspapers , the Daily Manab Zamin and NNP Nation , apologized afterward for reporting it as fact . It is bad enough when NN theorists VBP such things without foundation ; these then VBP picked up and broadcast by individuals , but when legitimate NN organizations do so it is much more disturbing . As CD commentator about this incident suggested , “ Their excuse : ‘ We thought it was true so we printed it without checking . ’ ” Throughout the latter third of the 20th century and into the 21st , with public confidence in the U.S. NN declining because of Vietnam , Watergate and other scandals and malfeasance , it became somewhat easier for NNS to VB the worst . There has been considerable NN on the parts of society that embrace NN theories of all types . Arguing that conspiracism writ JJ represents a fundamental part of the political system , legal scholar Mark Fenster argues that at sum , denials of the moon landings bring to the fore “ a polarization so profound that NNS end up with an unshakable belief that those in power ‘ simply ca n’t be trusted . ’ ” During a fall 2009 trip to Vladivostok , Russia , I gave four presentations about the moon landings to NN students . In every case , the JJ question from the students was about challenges to the moon - landing account made by NN theorists . All of them channeled the standard criticisms of Apollo made by denialists over the NNS . A radio talk show host , Rob McConnell , declared that listeners to his show The X Zone , offered astounding responses to CD questions — “ Do you VB in ghosts , and did American astronauts really walk on the Moon ? ” — 77 percent of respondents VBD yes to belief in ghosts , and 93 percent VBD that they did not VB that the Moon landings had actually occurred . As Seth Shostak from the SETI Institute remarked about this , “ The respondents VBP in ghosts , but do not VB NASA put NNS on the moon . On the CD hand , you have uncorroborated testimony about noises in the attic . On the other , you have a decade of effort by tens of thousands of engineers and NNS , endless rocket hardware , thousands of photos , and 378 kilograms ( 840 pounds ) of moon rock . ” Shostak was befuddled by this reality of modern American society . Apollo 17 astronaut Harrison Schmitt was more philosophical . “ If NNS decide they ’re VBG to deny the facts of history and the facts of NN and technology , ” he VBD , “ there ’s not much you can do with them . For most of them , I just feel sorry that we failed in their education . ” There can be no question that the February 2001 airing of the Fox television special NNP NNP : Did We Land on the Moon ? changed the nature of the debate . In this instance , a major network presented a NN scenario without any serious rebuttal that might have been offered . As USA Today reported : “ According to Fox and its respectfully interviewed “ experts ” — a constellation of ludicrously marginal and utterly uncredentialed ‘ investigative journalists ’ — the U.S. grew so eager to defeat the Soviets in the intensely competitive 1960s NN race that it faked all six Apollo missions that purportedly landed on the moon . Instead of exploring the lunar NN , the American astronauts only tromped around a crude movie set that was created by the plotters in the legendary Area 51 of the Nevada desert . ” While the program claimed to “ let the viewer decide ” about the validity of the claims for denial of the moon landings , it made no attempt whatsoever to offer point and counterpoint , thereby giving the viewers a seriously biased view of the issue and skewed evidence in favor of a hoax . The most egregious violation of propriety came in the Fox show when NN theorists claimed that ten astronauts and CD civilians had died “ under mysterious circumstances ” during the Apollo program . The ten astronauts in question included the three who were killed in the Apollo 1 fire of January 27 , 1967 , when their capsule was consumed in a flash fire during ground tests . At CD point , Scott Grissom , son of Apollo 1 mission commander Gus Grissom , who was killed in the incident , claimed , “ My father ’s death was no accident . He was murdered . ” At another point , however , he retracted that statement and declared that “ NASA did n’t murder anyone . ” No question , shoddy workmanship and poor procedures led to those astronauts ’ deaths , and it was a tragic loss . But the deaths of Grissom , Ed White and Roger Chaffee were an accident and not murder . Some moon - landing deniers have claimed that NASA had them killed because Grissom was on the verge of exposing the Apollo program as a fraud . There is not CD scintilla of evidence to support this accusation . The identity of the remaining seven astronauts presumably “ murdered ” by NASA during Apollo is something of a mystery . To be sure , astronaut Ed Givens died in an automobile accident , and astronauts Ted Freeman , C. C. Williams , Elliot NNP and Charlie Bassett died in aircraft accidents , but these were far removed from the conduct of Project Apollo . This accounts for eight astronauts , but those making this claim RB apparently count as astronauts CD other pilots who had nothing to do with the moon - landing program , X - 15 pilot Mike Adams and Air Force Manned Orbiting Laboratory pilot Robert Lawrence . Finally , they claimed that NASA technician Thomas Baron and another NASA civilian , who was unnamed , were murdered to keep the secret of the moon hoax . None of these claims was founded on any credible evidence . The Fox program fueled an explosion in NN theories about the Moon landings and the audience for them . I was inundated with questions from friends and acquaintances — JJ of whom I thought were smarter than that — asking me to explain why the photos showed no stars and why the flag moved . text: Organizations concerned about our waste of natural capital are gathering for a JJ summit in Bonn this weekend , amid tough times for the sustainability agenda . This NN 's focus will be on volunteer 's role in shaping sustainable societies . " NGOs and responsive citizens – the NNS – act at the heart of societies , " VBD the head of the NNP Nations Volunteers ( UNV ) program , Faliva Pansieri . " Sustainability and JJ well - being are finally coming to center stage . " Bonn , the former German capital , is an appropriate venue for the conference , which is expecting some 2,200 participants . Although no longer the seat of the German parliament , the city on the Rhine is now home to 18 UN organizations , which work mainly in the field of sustainable development . In addition , about 170 UN - affiliated NGOs are based in Bonn . " This NN , the platform is on the subject of changing our lifestyles , our JJ models , our JJ organization and political NN so that we can connect the dots between NN NN , NN , NN and food , " VBD Maria - Luisa Chavez , the UN's Chief of NGO Relations . The origins of non-governmental , non-profit organizations VBP RB to the 19th century when the JJ anti-slavery groups were founded . Since then , the number of NGOs has skyrocketed . They are especially active in the fields of JJ protection , JJ justice , JJ rights and humanitarian aid . But in recent NNS - between food crises , JJ doldrums and a range of conflicts around the NN - NGOs concerned about how rapidly we are wasting our natural capital are having a tough NN getting their message across . Problems IN NN NN , desertification , resource - use and the loss of NNS have only grown more acute since the 1992 " NNP Summit , " which RB saw NGOs invited to take part in UN discussions to tackle these problems . From Rio to Bonn and RB The NNP Summit , which debuted in Rio de Janeiro , will be held for the 20th NN next NN and preparations for Rio+20 are high on the agenda in Bonn this weekend . " Sustainable development and environment at the moment are not having a good NN , " VBD Felix Dodds , executive director of the Stakeholder Forum for a Sustainable Future , and the conference chairman . " I VBP that MD well VB worse unless we make sure that Rio in 2012 gives us a JJ road map to sustainable development . " He VBD if governments had delivered on the commitments they made in the past then we MD already be on a road to sustainable development . " Those are now broken promises and broken promises have to stop , " he added . Things have changed since 1992 , Dodds VBD , and priorities have shifted . Today issues IN NN NN , the connection between the environment and security , and access to food , NN and NN have gained JJ urgency . In addition , consumer behavior in industrialized NNS has widened the gap between the developed and developing NN . But the gap between the wealthy and the struggling within the Western NN has RB grown . Fro Bernward Geier , former director of the International Federation of Organic Agriculture Movements ( IFOAM ) , the NN for action is now . Today he is the coordinator of the German NGOs at the conference – 20 NNS ago he was an enthusiastic participant at the Rio summit . He VBD he 's seen " too much rhetoric and too little action " over the NNS and VBZ Rio 2012 is the last chance to really put a program into action before it is too late . " When I consider the momentum we have here in Bonn and VBP how the German NGO community , which is normally pretty critical of the UN , is getting excited , I feel a little flicker of hope , " he VBD . " We have JJ problems and we have to find solutions in a JJ context and then put them into practice on the local and regional level . " Some have been critical of the number of conferences that are held on development and the environment , saying it has led to a sort of meeting fatigue . But Felix Dodd counters that , saying that only conferences that do n't bring results result in annoyance and weariness . " Rio will not be a fatigue conference , it will be a successful NN , " he VBD . " And so as we are VBG to have a successful NN , the general public and politicians will VB it as an important NN . "

text: More From Landsat : Landsat ’s Most Historically Significant Images NNP as Art : Stunning Images From SpaceImages of NNP from NN give us a different , often enlightening and RB inspirational view of our planet . The USGS and NASA have taken some of the more interesting images from the Landsat satellites and added some false color , digitally produced by sensors on the satellites , to accentuate different features and create some truly beautiful works of art . The JJ Landsat satellite was launched on July 23 , 1972 . To celebrate the 40th anniversary of the Landsat mission , the public was given the difficult task of choosing the best of the more than 120 images in the NNP as Art collection . The top five selections , based on more than 14,000 votes , are featured here in descending order ( above : JJ place ) . Your challenge is to select just CD of these incredible images for your computer desktop . Above : In the style of Van Gogh 's painting " Starry Night , " massive congregations of greenish phytoplankton swirl in the dark NN around Gotland , a Swedish island in the Baltic NNP . Population explosions , or blooms , of phytoplankton , IN the NN shown here , occur when deep currents bring nutrients up to sunlit NN waters , fueling the growth and reproduction of these tiny plants . This image was acquired by Landsat 7 on July 13 , 2005 . Image and caption : NASA 's Goddard NNP Flight Center / USGS . Countless lakes , sloughs , and ponds are scattered throughout this scene of the Yukon Delta in southwest Alaska . CD of the largest river deltas in the NN , and protected as part of the Yukon Delta National Wildlife Refuge , the river 's sinuous waterways seem IN NN vessels branching out to enclose an organ . This image was acquired by Landsat 7 Sept. 22 , 2002 . Image and caption : NASA 's Goddard NNP Flight Center / USGS . Small , blocky shapes of towns , fields , and pastures surround the graceful swirls and whorls of the Mississippi River , the largest river system in North America . Countless oxbow lakes and cutoffs accompany the meandering river south of Memphis , Tennessee , on the border between Arkansas and Mississippi . This image was acquired by Landsat 7 on NNP 28 , 2003 . Image and caption : NASA 's Goddard NNP Flight Center / USGS . What look IN pale yellow paint streaks slashing through a mosaic of mottled colors are ridges of wind - blown sand that make up Erg Iguidi , an area of ever - shifting sand dunes extending from Algeria into Mauritania in northwestern Africa . Erg Iguidi is CD of several Saharan ergs , or sand seas , where individual dunes often surpass 500 meters ( nearly a third of a mile ) in both width and height . This image was acquired by Landsat 5 on April 8 , 1985 . Image and caption : NASA 's Goddard NNP Flight Center / USGS . The scary face in this image is actually inundated patches of shallow Lake Eyre ( pronounced " air " ) in the desert country of northern South Australia . An ephemeral feature of this JJ , parched landscape , Lake Eyre is Australia 's largest lake when it 's full . However in the last 150 NNS , it has filled completely only three times . This image was acquired by Landsat 5 on Aug. 5 , 2006 . Image and caption : NASA 's Goddard NNP Flight Center / USGS .

text: RB the minisuperspace calculation is hard to solve exactly , but physicists VBP there are CD possible expansion histories that potentially dominate the calculation . These rival universe shapes anchor the CD sides of the current debate . The rival solutions are the CD “ classical ” expansion histories that a universe can have . Following an initial spurt of cosmic inflation from size zero , these universes steadily expand according to Einstein ’s NN of gravity and NN - NN . Weirder expansion histories , IN football - shaped universes or caterpillar - JJ ones , mostly cancel out in the quantum calculation . CD of the CD classical solutions resembles our universe . On JJ scales , it ’s smooth and randomly dappled with NN , due to quantum fluctuations during inflation . As in the real universe , density differences between regions form a bell curve around zero . If this possible solution does indeed dominate the wave function for minisuperspace , it becomes plausible to imagine that a far more detailed and exact version of the no-boundary wave function might serve as a viable cosmological model of the real universe . The other potentially dominant universe shape is nothing IN reality . As it widens , the NN infusing it varies more and more extremely , creating enormous density differences from CD place to the next that gravity steadily worsens . Density variations form an inverted bell curve , where differences between regions approach not zero , but infinity . If this is the dominant term in the no-boundary wave function for minisuperspace , then the Hartle - Hawking proposal MD seem to be wrong . The CD dominant expansion histories present a choice in how the path integral should be done . If the dominant histories are CD locations on a map , megacities in the realm of all possible quantum mechanical universes , the question is which path we should take through the terrain . Which dominant expansion history , and there can only be CD , should our “ contour of integration ” pick up ? Researchers have forked down different paths . In their 2017 paper , Turok , Feldbrugge and Lehners took a path through the garden of possible expansion histories that led to the second dominant solution . In their view , the only sensible contour is CD that scans through real values ( as opposed to imaginary values , which involve the square roots of negative numbers ) for a variable called “ lapse . ” Lapse is essentially the height of each possible shuttlecock universe — the distance it takes to reach a certain diameter . Lacking a causal element , lapse is not quite our usual notion of NN . Yet Turok and colleagues argue partly on the grounds of causality that only real values of lapse make physical sense . And summing over universes with real values of lapse leads to the wildly fluctuating , physically nonsensical solution . “ NNS place huge faith in Stephen ’s intuition , ” Turok VBD by phone . “ For good reason — I mean , he probably had the best intuition of anyone on these topics . But he was n’t always JJ . ” Jonathan Halliwell , a physicist at Imperial College London , has studied the no-boundary proposal since he was Hawking ’s student in the 1980s . He and Hartle analyzed the issue of the contour of integration in 1990 . In their view , as well as Hertog ’s , and apparently Hawking ’s , the contour is not fundamental , but rather a mathematical tool that can be placed to greatest advantage . It ’s similar to how the trajectory of a planet around the sun can be expressed mathematically as a series of angles , as a series of times , or in terms of any of several other convenient parameters . “ You can do that parameterization in JJ different ways , but none of them are any more physical than another NN , ” Halliwell VBD . He and his colleagues argue that , in the minisuperspace case , only contours that pick up the good expansion history make sense . Quantum mechanics requires probabilities to add to 1 , or be “ normalizable , ” but the wildly fluctuating universe that Turok ’s team landed on is not . That solution is nonsensical , plagued by infinities and disallowed by quantum laws — obvious signs , according to no -boundary ’s defenders , to walk the other NN . It ’s true that contours passing through the good solution sum up possible universes with imaginary values for their lapse variables . But apart from Turok and NN , few NNS VBP that ’s a problem . Imaginary numbers pervade quantum mechanics . To team Hartle - Hawking , the critics are invoking a false notion of causality in demanding that lapse be real . “ That ’s a principle which is not written in the stars , and which we profoundly disagree with , ” Hertog VBD .

text: So where do we VB when we die ? I guess this is the question we all VBP the answer to , and indeed we should . Because inner-standing the vastness and complexity to this Matrix construct and how it operates can only serve to shield and protect ourselves when we do inevitably reach that point . What I am talking about in this blog is based upon NNS of NN , you can take it or leave it . I am not attempting to force this upon NNS merely putting out that of which deeply resonates as NN . The fact is humanity is involved in a soul harvesting trap , I have written about this extensively previously in other blogs . It has been sold to us through ancient indoctrination as simply ‘ reincarnation ’ a method whereby you can come RB and ‘ resolve ’ any outstanding karma on this Planet . This is a falsehood , we have been deceived and tricked and it has been VBG on for JJ JJ NNS . What is happening is that we are being lured and tricked by the false white light and deceivers acting as benevolent beings , who are essentially there to just hook as RB into coming RB down for another dose on Planet crazy . Let me explain further . The whole after death experience is nothing more than an AI simulation . As you die you will VB a tunnel filled with white light , you MD feel immediately drawn to it as there is a familiarity due to what you MD have read or heard about in your physical NN . We must remember that ignorance does n’t die when we die , thats why its so important to seek knowledge in your physical NN , do your own NN , and not be drawn into the JJ traps and deceptions put out there by the Matrix agents in this dimension , those in NN , mainstream NN , and so on . So the white light is the JJ deception , once you enter the white light you will be met with false white light beings . These beings MD masquerade as whatever you admired in your physical NN , maybe some kind of deity , Jesus , Buddha or RB a close family member . These beings VBP us intimately and VBP our blind spots and the ways in which to appeal to our emotions . From there you are taken for a NN review whereby you are shown perhaps certain times in your NN where you MD have hurt someone or made a mistake , they will play on your guilt and emotions once again , and RB deceive us into volunteering to come RB down to NNP by promising that we can come RB to ‘ resolve our karma ’ . In reality all that is happening is that we are being sent RB down to have our NN siphoned again for interdimensionals , entities , and parasitic NN agencies . We are the food they need to feed on , and hence they need us RB down on the feeding ground . Most humans will volunteer quite easily , although most do n’t really VB to come RB down . This is due to ignorance or fear of not ending up in some kind of ‘ heaven ’s they do n’t resolve their karma . Some JJ souls are so tired they VBP to a kind of resting area before they have their memories wiped and are sent RB down into another JJ NN . And so the cycle begins again . So how can we escape this soul trap and where do we VB ? Well , RB of all awareness is key , just RB knowing that this entrapment construct exists is empowering in and of itself . There have been a few theories put forward about what to do and where to VB . The murdered Max Spiers often spoke about VBG into your heart NN . It is my inner-standing that there is a type of grid around this NNP , now this is n’t the place to discuss whether the NNP is JJ or round lets put that aside for CD second , although there is no NN I VBP NASA and the photos that they put out ! This grid , or maybe RB what is depicted as a dome in JJ films , is holding this Matrix construct together so NNS cannot leave and remain entrapped here . What has happened over the last few decades however , is that as NNS start to become more consciously aware and start to ‘ wake up ’ it is creating holes in this grid . Everything we VBP in terms of our own solar system is a holographic projection WITHIN this grid . Its not to say that these Planets do n’t exist , its just that they are within this Matrix grid . Outside the grid it where the REAL freedom and expansiveness of NN lies , a place where we can travel instantly through thought alone , unlike here where we are bound by the constructs of this artificial construct . As I talk about in my blog below , there is a NN out and it involves being strong willed when you leave your physical NN . Clearly its not a good idea to VB to the false white light , nor is it wise to stop and talk to any beings no matter how ‘ friendly ’ they might show themselves to be . The idea is , by using thought ( as you wo n’t have your physical NN anymore ) is to head for the grid , and in particular CD of these holes that I spoke about previously . As the Planet rises in consciousness I estimate that there will be more and more of these holes in the grid . Bypass everything else and navigate your NN through , do this without fear as we are always creating through our thoughts . As you navigate through the same thing applies , use discernment when making decisions and interacting with any beings . Chances are there will be JJ more benevolent forms of consciousnesses in that realm than within the grid but its still good practice to discern . From there you ’re free to explore as your consciousness wants to . My vlog below explains more in detail so check it out and feel free to subscribe to my NNP channel for more NN and viewpoints ! If you VBD this article helpful please share with others to raise awareness , and consider subscribing to my weekly newsletter below to keep in touch with my work and announcements .

text: Millions of NNS around the globe gathered on the internet to watch in awe SpaceX ’s live stream of the rocket blasting off from the Kennedy NNP Centre in Florida at 3.45 pm EST ( 8.45 pm GMT ) . Thousands more gathered at the Cape Canaveral NN centre yesterday , joyously counting down the seconds until the rocket sent a Tesla Roadster on a billion NN journey through NN . But droves of skeptics and disbelievers immediately took to JJ NN platforms to voice their concerns and accuse SpaceX of faking the whole operation . JJ Earthers , who are individuals who cling on to the disproven NN that the NNP is a JJ disk and not an oblate sphere , claimed the stream was CGI . The official NNP NNP Society NNP page VBD today : “ NNS who VBP that the NNP is a globe because ‘ they saw a car in NN on the Internet ’ must be the JJ incarnation of ‘ It 's true , I saw it on TV ! ’ “ It 's a poor argument . Why MD we VB any privately - held NN to report the NN ? ” The group further agued the NN were in on SpaceX ’s agenda , helping out the rocket manufacturer with the alleged deception . The society added in response to a challenger : “ You should n't trust us . You should evaluate claims independently . We 've never advocated for anything else . ” Another NNP user under the handle of Forever NNP , VBD : “ For all of you , who watched the Falcon Heavy . Saw a car VB to NN , saw NO satellites , NO ISS , NO NN debris , NO oblate spheroid , NO spinning NNP , NO escape velocity , NO speeds of 20 kmph , NO stars , just stationary blackness . ” SpaceX founder Elon Musk , entertained the NNP Earthers in a post - launch interview . Mr Musk joked the car looked too “ weird , too crisp ” to be real . Mr Musk VBD : " You can tell it ’s real because it looks so JJ . " It ’s just literally a normal car in NN , which I kind of VBP the absurdity of that . " Those who watched the SpaceX feed saw the expensive electric car breathtakingly hang over the blue planet below , immediately disproving conspiracies the NNP is anything but a globe . From its vantage point thousands of kilometres above the NNP , Mr Musk admitted watching the Roadster and its dummy Starman pilot in real NN was a “ surreal ” experience . You can watch the recorded SpaceX feed in full here : SpaceX Falcon Heavy launch live stream But not everyone was convinced by the stream . JJ truthers questioned the apparent lack of stars against vast expanse of NN , while others pointed out the planet appeared to be stationary . NNP account Prof Brian Hoax tweeted : “ Surely , you do n't need to be a JJ NNP believer to recognise the fakery . “ Its not a JJ NNP vs globe matter , its exposure of the fraud and mockery . This affects us all . ” Unfortunately the JJ NN NN is supported by JJ prominent celebrities such as raper B.o.B. , cricketer Freddie Flintoff and NBA star Kyrie Irving . The same NNS VBP NASA and other respected scientific bodies are perpetuating the “ globe hoax ” for their own ends . B.o. B challenged NASA last NN by pledging to send a satellite into NN to settle the debate . text: Katy Perry ’s “ Dark Horse ” is a fun and colorful NN taking place in Ancient Egypt . However , behind the cartoonish style of the NN , viewers are exposed to a great deal of symbolism of the occult elite and messages regarding its power . We ’ll look at the symbolism of “ Dark Horse ” . Katy Perry is a gigantic pop star , mainly because her songs and videos appeal to teens and pre-teens while her NN - appeal captures the attention of the older crowd . This makes her a perfect tool to be used by the elite to communicate its messages and , as seen in previous articles about her , her songs and videos are fully used for that purpose . Dark Horse , however , is on a whole other level . It is pure , relentless , in - your - face Illuminati symbolism , interlaced with references to the elite ’s brand of black magic and mind NN . Playing the role of “ Katy - Patra ” , an Egyptian pharaoh reminiscent of ancient NN symbol Cleopatra , Katy Perry rules over her subjects the same NN the occult elite rules over the NN . In my article on the 2014 Grammy Awards , I described Katy Perry ’s performance of Dark Horse as a black magick ritual disguised as a music performance . The NN goes straight to the roots of this sorcery : Egyptian Black Magick , the original source that is tapped into by today ’s dark secret societies . Before we look at the actual NN , let ’s look at its trailer , which contains a few interesting elements . Then the trailer VBZ that Kings MD travel from “ Brooklyn to Babylon ” to meet her . Babylon , which was a real ancient metropolis located where Iraq is today , was ruled by various ancient empires and has RB been an epicenter of the elite ’s black magic . Let ’s look at the NN . Dark Horse takes place in a colorful , NN - friendly version of Ancient Egypt that ’s been “ hip - hop- ized ” about 15 % to appeal to its target audience . Katy Perry plays the role of an evil , greedy , egotistical , despotic pharaoh named Katy - Patra who destroys men for their belongings . What a great lesson for girls under the age of 14 . In a wider sense , Katy - Patra ’s rule represents the occult elite taking resources and power from nations ( represented by the kings ) . What a great lesson for the rest of the NN . Throughout the NN , it is firmly established that Katy - Patra is an evil tyrant using black magic to VB and destroy NNS while having a bunch of kitten slaves at her NNS . Kind of IN what the occult elite does . And of course , there are all kinds of blatant symbols that show her to be a representative of the Illuminati . The above scenes tell plenty about the occult - elite influenced mythology of the NN . Katy - Patra is looked upon by Anubis , the jackal - headed NN of death , probably because she likes to kill NNS . Behind her is the falcon - headed NN Horus wearing gold chains ( to make him look “ cool ” to young , impressionable viewers ) . Notice that he only has CD eye – a reference , once again , to the All - Seeing Eye of Horus . More importantly , Katy - Patra is surrounded by a golden snake , which probably refers to the evil Egyptian NN Apep . Three 6 Mafia rapper Juicy J makes an appearance in the NN and his entrance is pretty darn symbolic too . He literally emerges from some kind sarcophagus , which features the occult elite ’s favorite symbol in lieu of eyes : The Eye of Horus inside a triangle . On top of all of that symbolism , we must never forget another part of the Agenda : Exposing young NNS to hyper - sexualization . The NN is essentially about kings from other nations trying to wow Katy - Patra with amazing gifts . The JJ suitor offers her a gigantic diamond . Katy - Patra immediately orders her kitten slaves to snatch that diamond from the suitor . The above image is symbolic for a few reasons : RB , it tells the viewers that Katy - Patra plays the role of the occult elite in the NN . Second , she CANNOT VB through the Eye ( it is opaque ) . She instead sees the diamond through the elite ’s “ eyes ” , which are focused on greed , power , and material possessions . Finally , NNS who watch music videos need to be exposed to that CD - eye sign all the NN . I MD stop the NN analysis here . What else do you truly need to VB about the NN ? Katy Perry is looking at a big diamond using an Eye of Horus to hide CD eye . This scene is a 100 % continuation of about everything I ’ve ever talked about on this site . And there it is again , RB in our faces , in CD of the NN ’s most popular videos . Really , how can anyone VB that all this symbolism is “ just a coincidence ” ? Anyhow , RB to the NN . The next suitor tries to entice Katy - Patra ’s gluttony by offering her food . Of course , things do not turn out great for that guy , either . The last suitor brings what Katy - Patra really wants : Power . Seeing this pyramid , Katy - Patra gets very excited because that ’s what she , and the elite , truly wants : Unlimited occult power over the NN . The illuminated pyramid essentially represents the Illuminati ’s high - tech NN over the NN . When Katy - Patra steps on top of the unfinished pyramid , she becomes imbued with crazy magical powers . She RB grows wings . The NN ends with Katy - Patra becoming a super - Illuminati pharaoh … and everyone bows down to her … and the suitor turns into a chihuahua . The moral of the NN ? Illuminati . It is rather hard to VB that all of this Illuminati symbolism was packed into a NN that only lasts 3 minutes and 40 seconds . It is RB harder to VB that some NNS still cannot VB the obvious pattern of symbols VBN in mass NN that transcends artists , music genres , and RB NN outlets . Far from being random , these symbols have been used for centuries to represent the occult elite and they are now all over the place . More than just flashing symbols , the NN Dark Horse tells a darker NN : the occult elite ’s insatiable greed for ultimate power while dismissing the petty rulers operating underneath it . Katy - Patra indeed takes resources from various kings of the NN and then destroys them . In the end , she climbs on an Illuminati pyramid and turns into an unstoppable pharaoh imbued with magical powers . MD the brainwashing be more obvious ? In short , Dark Horse is Illuminati propaganda aimed at NNS , using bright colors and catchy hooks to subliminally teach them who rules the NN and who controls the idols that they love and emulate . Of course , none of this is clearly spelled out . Instead , it comes at you through symbolism … IN a dark horse .

text: When he RB heard about the idea of a JJ NNP Robbie Davidson thought the notion that the NN was not a sphere was crazy . “ I thought the idea of a JJ NNP was ridiculous , ” VBD Robbie Davidson , a slim , hyper Canadian sporting a ginger goatee and loose fitting suit while sitting in the lobby of a Denver hotel . But not any more . The hotel is hosting the second annual NNP NNP International Conference – an event that Davidson himself founded and organized . “ I ’d RB heard it in the Bible and thought ‘ this ca n’t be true , ’ ” he recalled , speaking with rapid excitement . “ I mean , I believed everything else , that the NNP was created in six literal days , but what about all this other stuff [ about a JJ NNP ] ? To be consistent as a biblical literalist , I ca n’t pick and choose . ” David ’s conversion to believing in a JJ NN was only a few NNS ago , yet in that NN he and scores of others around the globe – including a few celebrities – have subscribed to the idea that the NNP is shaped IN a pancake . The theories splinter off from there , with varying ideas about who is propagating misinformation about the NNP ’s shape and why , but there are a number of unifying touchstones : Nasa , Freemasons , the “ faked ” moon landing , globalists , Elon Musk . But perhaps the most common thread is the Bible , and the conviction of its fundamental NN . That makes evangelical Christians CD of largest and most enthusiastic groups who embrace the NN , but they are RB CD of the least reported on and CD that causes immense controversy in their own community . Yet walking the halls of the conference – where 650 NNS from around the NN paid up to $ 350 to attend lectures about their horizontal idea of the planet – it ’s not uncommon to VB NNS praying over CD another , discussing apocalyptic theories about “ end times ” , or swapping Bible verses that describe the NNP in a non-spherical fashion . “ I ’ve VBN over 200 scriptures that corroborate the idea that we are living on a stationary , JJ NNP , ” VBD Nathan Roberts , CD of JJ “ cosmological evangelists ” speaking at the event . And yet most evangelicals , IN most NNS , despise the work that he does on a JJ NNP . “ The most persecution I ’ve faced has been from within the church , ” Roberts VBD . At a NN when evangelicals are facing somewhat of a public relations crisis–backlash against their LGBT stance , prosperity doctrines and overwhelming support of the NNP 2016 NN , observers say it makes sense they MD bristle at any associations with the JJ NNP movement . Throughout the last century , evangelicals have had a love - hate relationship with fundamentalist Christians , who are an evangelical subculture who VBP the Bible as a historical , scientifically factual account of NN events . Mainstream evangelicals tend to employ what ’s VBN as “ seeker sensitive ” tactics of neutral politics , live rock music and charming , hip pastors , attracting celebrities IN Chris Pratt , Justin Bieber and Kim Kardashian . Whereas fundamentalist Christians are typically less frills and more idealism , often leading to homeschooling , survivalist lifestyles , and a focus on the Book of Revelation . JJ Earthers ( or “ biblical Earthers , ” as some distinguish themselves at this conference ) are a JJ subculture of American fundamentalist Christianity . It ’s a marriage of anti-government NN theories ( Nasa ’s NN program is a complete lie ) with biblical literalism ( the NNP is the JJ , center of the universe , with heaven above the sky and hell below the ground ) . The movement does claim a few celebrities . In 2007 The View co-host and evangelical Christian Sherri Shepherd caused a collective gasp in the early NN of JJ NN when she publicly questioned whether the NNP was JJ . Former MTV diva Tila Tequila , rapper B.o.B. , and Boston Celtics Kyrie Irving have all publicly identified as JJ Earthers . Paul made a brief appearance on stage , where he announced he was “ coming out of the JJ NNP closet ” to a thunderous applause from the crowd . Their increase in relevance is primarily due to JJ NN and an endlessly curious NN . The Washington Post , for example , has run six separate articles about an amateur rocketeer attempting to kiss the sky and NN - record that the NN is JJ . But for the most part , JJ Earthers are CD of the most mocked subcultures of our NN . They have inspired the ire of Neil deGrasse Tyson , Modern Family and an evangelical scholar whose work they have cited as evidence for their NN . “ They ’ve taken my writing about ancient Israelite cosmology , interpreted it in this uber - literal NN , and used it to prop up this JJ NNP idea , ” VBD Michael Heiser , a biblical scholar from Liberty NNP and host of The Naked Bible podcast , who has expressed his frustration with the misinterpretation of his work by JJ Earthers . You have references to the NNP being set upon a foundation , VBN as the pillars of the NNP . You have waters beneath the NNP , which is the realm of the dead . “ All of this is standard vocabulary for how NNS of this NN and place viewed the NN . They did n’t VB about Antarctica or NNP Zealand . The Bible is an ancient Mediterranean - centered document , written by NNS who are describing their NN through their experiences . The mountains are described as holding the dome of the sky in place , but there was no REI store nearby where they MD buy mountain climbing gear and scale these peaks to VB what was VBG on . ” Heiser is a Christian himself , albeit CD who prefers to view the Bible in its historical context . JJ NNS at the conference , including Davidson , say they have been kicked out of churches , or lost jobs with churches , or suffered broken relationships with family members because they have gone public with their beliefs about a JJ NNP . text: CHICAGO ( Reuters ) - If Scott Troetel is out with friends when the Indianapolis Colts are playing , he often reaches for his Blackberry to check how running NN Joseph Addai is doing . But Troetel , who is 32 and lives in Boulder , Colorado , is not particularly interested in the Colts . Addai ’s performance is crucial to “ Addai in the NNP , ” Troetel ’s fantasy football team . Fantasy sports , where fans select real athletes for make - VBP teams , are exploding onto JJ platforms IN smart phones and JJ networking sites , grabbing the attention of advertisers , wireless carriers and software NNS . And with a growing number of NNS playing casual games on the Internet and a largely untapped market outside the NNP NNPS , analysts say the market for fantasy sports can only grow . Among NNS benefiting from this growth is 4 I nfo , which alerts its users to things IN sports scores and celebrity gossip via text message , with its revenue coming from advertisers . Of the half a billion text messages that 4 I n fo expects to send this NN , as JJ as 15 percent will be to NNS seeking sports results to feed into their fantasy sports teams , VBD CEO Zaw Thet . “ NNS have yet to realize the full potential of fantasy as it really comes to the cell phone and we ’ll VB that over the course of the next several NNS , ” VBD Thet , whose NN is backed by Gannett Co , General Electric Co ’s NBC Universal and venture capital firms . While there is disagreement on the origin of fantasy sports , they came to wide attention with the publication of “ Rotisserie League Baseball ” in 1984 , based on a league played by a group of NNP York NN types and rules by magazine writer Daniel Okrent . The appeal of fantasy leagues to sports fanatics is often cited as a factor in the early success of USA Today , which was launched in 1982 with more detailed baseball statistics than other newspapers . “ It ’s IN you ’ve combined the old macho notion of knowing more than anybody about sports with Dungeons and Dragons , ” VBD Robert Thompson , professor of pop culture at Syracuse NNP . “ It turns out that ’s a pretty good marriage . ” Troetel , for example , checks on his players at least CD or three times a week , using his handheld device to VB to the relevant websites . “ The NN I VBP sports now is far and away greater than if I did n’t play fantasy sports , ” he VBD . Fantasy sports took an exponential leap in the late 1990s as the Internet made sports results more widely available and sites IN Yahoo Inc began to host fantasy sports leagues for a fee . There are now more than 27 million players in the NNP NNPS and annual revenue is in the range of $ 800 million to $ 1 billion , according to the Fantasy Sports Trade Association . Fans already use their mobile phones to read sports NN , review game scores and check on their teams . Wireless carriers are now working to align themselves exclusively with whatever sports properties they can as a NN to make themselves more attractive to consumers . “ If you ’re the only NN who offers what NNS VBP , they ’re VBG to find a NN to switch to your service , ” VBD Steve Gaffney , director of sports and entertainment marketing for Sprint Nextel Corp , which has deals with the National Football League and the National Association for Stock Car Auto Racing ( NASCAR ) . While small screens are not that attractive to advertisers , smart phones IN NNP in Motion ’s Blackberry and Apple ’s iPhone that offer live streaming NN and other multimedia features is undeniable , VBD Bob Bowman , chief executive of Major League Baseball ’s advanced NN unit . Another growth area is JJ networking sites IN NNP , which is hosting a fantasy football game with 350,000 users since it started in July , making it CD of the larger fantasy football games on the Internet . “ Fantasy sports at its core is a set of microcommunities of your good friends that you VBP to stay in touch with and ‘ talk smack ’ to , and NNP allows NNS to do that , ” VBD Jeff Ma , co-founder of Citizen Sports Network , which runs the NNP game in partnership with NNP Warner ’s Sports Illustrated . Ma , whose San Francisco - based firm is backed by venture capitalists Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers , is the basis for the main character in the book “ Bringing Down the House ” and the movie “ 21 , ” in which a group of students used math to win millions of dollars from casinos . Another big growth area for fantasy sports is among so - called casual gamers , those whose interest is limited or who MD not have a lot of free NN to play . ESPN , a unit of Walt Disney Co , in late August introduced a game where users try to select winners and top performers in an effort to be JJ to build a 25 - pick winning streak over four months that MD net a $ 1 million prize . “ It ’s our strategy to develop games that are very easy to play , ” VBD Raphael Poplock , vice NN of games for ESPN Digital NN . These casual players MD VB almost double the number of fantasy sports players to 50 million over the next five NNS , VBD Chris Russo , CEO of Fantasy Sports Ventures , a NN NN focused on fantasy sports . Other NNS taking advantage of the growth in fantasy sports include Google ’s NNP , Electronic Arts and advertisers IN Gillette and Coke . “ The sheer participation numbers are so overwhelming , ” VBD Andrew Bangs , a community marketing specialist with NNP , which launched a fantasy football channel in July . The growth in fantasy sports is RB feeding RB into the real sports leagues , where fantasy sports fans spend more NN engaged with real teams than fans who do n’t play fantasy sports . “ Nearly 60 percent of revenue comes from fans attending games , so to the extent I can VB a casual fan to VB to CD game that means a lot , ” baseball ’s Bowman VBD . “ If I can repeat that 10 million times , that ’s real money . ” Overseas markets offer another enticing opportunity , as games around cricket , soccer , rugby and other sports are not as developed as those in the NNP NNPS , VBD Steve Byrd , executive vice NN with Stats Inc , which licenses sports content and statistics for almost 90 different sports leagues . “ You VBP the growing middle class in China and India , with Internet access , they ’re VBG to VB to engage with their sports the NN that we do , ” he VBD . In addition , industry executives VBD the number of fantasy websites is exploding . That expansion will only speed up since the U.S. Supreme Court in June declined to hear the appeal by Major League Baseball of a lower - court ruling that any NN has the free - speech NN to use the names and performance statistics of famous athletes . Of course with so JJ NNS out there , there is bound to be a shakeout . “ CD out of every 10 sites makes it , ” VBD Rick Wolf , chairman of the Fantasy Sports Association . “ For the small NNS , it ’s very hard to succeed . ” Not everyone is in favor of fantasy sports . “ I am the JJ - NN society on this NN , ” VBD Dave Zirin , sports writer for The Nation , a left - wing magazine . “ It ’s a very atomizing experience to live in the NNP NNPS at times and so sports is CD of those few ways where we ’re able to VB a sense of collective joy . Fantasy sports runs counter to that . ” Allison Lodish just wants her husband RB . She launched Women Against Fantasy Sports ( http://womenagainstfantasysports.com) in August as a forum for frustrated spouses . The site ’s top - selling item is women ’s underwear with the slogan : “ Closed for the fantasy season . ”

text: Some of the best surfing spots in the NN are located along the U.S. West Coast and in Hawaii , and the reason is simple : the waves ! But why are waves on the West Coast bigger than those on the East Coast ? There are three primary factors that determine a wave 's height : According to the Encyclopedia of the NNP , a wave is " the oscillations of the NN caused by the wind blowing along the NN and moving in the direction in which the wind blows . " The important thing to remember about waves is that the NN is n't moving -- the NN from the wind is moving through the NN . On the West Coast , the prevailing winds are behind the waves , which increases the waves ' NN . On the East Coast , the prevailing winds blow against the incoming waves , decreasing the waves ' NN . ­ ­On each coast of the NNP NNPS is a continental shelf . To understand the continental shelf , let 's imagine that the NN dried up . The land under the NN looks a bit IN the Grand Canyon , with cliffs and valleys , plateaus and ridges . On the West Coast , if you walked out onto the continental shelf , you MD notice that the shelf ( the area between the beach and where the drop - off begins ) is narrower . This means that if you have less sand to walk on before the NN 's floor drops off steeply , IN a cliff . On the East Coast , the shelf is broader -- there is more sand to walk on as the shelf drops gradually , IN a really JJ ramp . Underneath the NN of the NN , particles are spinning in the direction that the wind is moving in . The particles are largest at the NN of the NN . The deeper you VBP in the NN , the smaller the spinning particles . As the wave moves inland and hits the upward slope of the continental shelf on the East Coast , the friction causes the particles to slow down , so the wave gradually collapses on itself . On the West Coast , the shelf rises suddenly near the coast , so the waves are much larger when they crash into the coastline -- the particles ( and thus the wave ) have n't been slowed down by extended friction with the shelf . The Pacific NNP on the West Coast has a greater expanse than the Atlantic NNP on the East Coast . This means that the fetch ( the distance over which the wind blows ) is greater on the West Coast than on the East Coast . In this case , you can VB of wave as a snowball : The farther you roll your snowball along in the snow , the bigger it gets . West - coast waves tend to start RB out in the Pacific NNP , so they have a greater distance to travel before they hit the shore -- more NN to grow in size and length . Dr. Ernie Knowles , associate professor of oceanography at NC NNP NNP , can VB us put all of this together : " The steep shelf on the West Coast MD VB a more abrupt buildup of the shoaling wave ( so waves MD be ' steeper ' when they break ) . But the much longer fetch in the Pacific NNP allows the waves to receive more wind NN , and so they grow larger . The swell arriving on the West Coast has periods in the range of 10 to 17 seconds ( quite JJ waves ) , while the East Coast swell is more in the six - to 10 - second range . " For more NN on waves and related topics , try the links on the next page .

In 2017 , Flintoff revealed he believes the NNP is not perfectly spherical - but has now taken it a step further by calling it turnip - shaped . When asked about his NNP NNP comments , " Freddie " - speaking to Laura Woods on talkSPORT - revealed : " It 's more IN a JJ turnip ... " I 'm not saying it 's IN a pancake , I 've never VBN that . " I 'm saying it 's slightly round , but not your perfect sphere . " NNS VBP I 'm daft , but if you VBP about it , there 's this thing called gravity that we 're sticking to the NN in ...
