text: Financial writer and book author John Rubino sees the NN careening toward a debt reset at an increasing pace . Rubino explains , “ The coming monetary reset and what that means for gold and what that means for the rest of the JJ financial system , you do n’t need a war to bring that about because we are making enough financial mistakes that will VB us there in no NN JJ now without geopolitical turmoil . If you add a big war in the Middle East into the equation , then anything can happen . They VBP Iran , and we have our allies helping us , and we start using these next generation weapons that are breathtakingly powerful . Nobody has any idea what ’s VBG to happen when we start throwing these things at each other . . . . Oil spikes to $ 100 – $ 150 per barrel , and that tips the already extremely fragile JJ financial system over the edge . So , we VBP the ‘ Greater Depression ’ or the monetary reset or a hyperinflation or whatever we VBP sooner rather than later . It ’s a disaster for everybody when it happens that NN . ” Rubino VBZ the monetary masters “ tried to fix the financial system but MD not do it . ” Rubino VBZ , “ If you VBP you are beyond the point of no return financially as an individual , you borrow as much money as you can , and then VB bankrupt . . . . Governments in the NN are starting to do that now or behaving that NN . . . . There is nothing they can do to fix the system . So , there is no point in holding that currency as savings . text: As this decade comes to an end , there have been quite a few moments that NNS have hoped and prayed had never happened . While these ' NN - in - mouth ' moments have numbered in the hundreds and thousands in this decade itself , we 've rounded up ten of the choicest moments , some of them quite embarrassing for those concerned . This list of ten moments includes not just personalities in India and across the NN , but RB certain events that have had a number of consequences for those involved . Here is a list of this decade 's most ' NN - in - mouth ' moments , in descending order : JJ - earthers are those who VBP , simply , that the NN is not round , but JJ . No matter the evidence given , JJ - earthers do not recognise the NN to be an oblate - spheroid , to use the terminology NNS have given to the planet 's shape . This movement has been around for a JJ NN , but has grown in popularity with the rise of JJ NN and NN theories . The movement has RB attracted a few celebrities to ridicule or support the movement . In 2017 , a rapper from the US started a GoFundMe page to crowdfund satellites to prove the NN was JJ . 9. Alia Bhatt and Varun Dhawan 's goof - ups on ' Koffee With Karan ' Bollywood celebrities Alia Bhatt and Varun Dhawan probably wished they MD have brushed up on their general knowledge before slipping up on filmmaker Karan Johar 's show , ' Koffee With Karan ' . On being asked who the NNP of the country was , Alia Bhatt and Varun Dhawan VBD ' Prithviraj Chavan ' and ' Manmohan Singh ' respectively . Both celebrities were massively trolled online for their answers and were the laughing stock of JJ NN users for quite a JJ NN . 8. Fyre Festival and the ' sad ' but viral cheese sandwich The Fyre Festival promised to be a modern - day Woodstock , with the festival 's organisers doubling down on the lavish promise of a grand music festival on an exotic island filled with food , drinks , music , luxurious bungalows to stay in and famous supermodels . Rich NNS who MD afford the extravagant price tag , upwards of $ 10,000 , flocked to the island , located in the Bahamas , only to be greeted with torrential rain a day before the festival was to kick off , small tents with dirty mattresses and ... CD breads with a cheese slice , tomato slices and lettuce leaves for food . A photo of the ' sad ' cheese sandwich went viral on JJ NN and marked the beginning of the end of festival . After a user posted the photo of the cheese sandwich , NN of the disaster that was the Fyre Festival broke out and went viral on JJ NN . CD of the festival 's organisers Billy McFarland , was convicted of fraud , while the other , famous rapper Ja Rule , distanced himself from the festival . JJ soft drink brand Pepsi hoped to capitalise on the anti-establishment fervour in 2017 , with an advertisement featuring celebrity socialite Kendall Jenner cutting across protestors and offering a policeman a can of Pepsi . With the ' Black Lives Matter ' protests that had sparked in the US , the ad provoked an outcry and was widely derided on JJ NN . Bernice King , the daughter of civil rights activist Martin Luther King , wrote a scathing response to the ad on NNP : " If only Daddy MD have VBN about the power of # Pepsi , " with a picture of her father being pushed by a police officer . Union Minister Piyush Goyal became the centre of attention on JJ NN in September this NN while commenting on the NN of the economy . Mr Goyal , while defending the NN 's handling of the economy , VBD " If you 're looking at a five trillion dollar economy , the country will have to grow at 12 % . Today it 's growing at 6 % . Do n't VB into those maths . Those maths have never helped Einstein discover gravity ... If you 'd only gone by structured formulae and what was past knowledge , I do n't VB there MD have been any innovation in this NN " . JJ NN was quick to point out that it was Isaac Newton and not Albert Einstein who discovered gravity . After being derided for the remarks on JJ NN , the minister VBD that some " sought to remove the context , pick up CD line and create a very mischievous narrative . " ' Alternative facts ' was a phrase famously coined by US NNP Donald NNP 's then White House advisor Kellyanne Conway . The phrase was coined after NNP 's former White House press secretary Sean Spicer 's alleged false statement on the number of NNS who had attended NNP 's inauguration ceremony . Conway used the term to justify Spicer 's claim that a JJ number of NNS had attended the ceremony , whereas photographic evidence proved otherwise . Donald NNP has been notorious for his comments on NN NN , including his recent barbs aimed at NN NN activist , 16 - NN - old Greta Thunberg . " The concept of JJ warming was created by and for the Chinese in order to make U.S. manufacturing non-competitive , " NNP had tweeted in 2012 . In another tweet , NNP VBD that JJ warming was needed because it was freezing and snowing in NNP York . Elon Musk stoked controversy last NN , when the incident involving several NNS being trapped inside a cave in Thailand made headlines the NN over , saw the tech billionaire play a role in rescue attempts as well . Following a disagreement with Vernon Unsworth , a British diver involved in rescuing the NNS , Elon Musk in a tweet , called him a " pedo guy " . Unsworth had described Musk 's proposal to build a mini-submarine to rescue the NNS as a " PR stunt " . The comment has proved to be costly for Musk , with an ensuing lawsuit as well as several clarifications issued by him . As recently as this month , Musk 's attorney Alex Spiro VBD " pedo guy " meant " creepy old guy " in South Africa , in a bid at damage NN . Former Junior Education Minister Satyapal Singh had last NN claimed that the NN of evolution put forth by naturalist Charles Darwin was " scientifically wrong " . " Ever since humans came to NNP , they have always been humans , " he had VBN , adding that " Nobody , including our ancestors , have VBN or written that they ever saw an ape turning into a JJ being . No book we have read or the tales VBN to us by our grandparents had any such mention " . The comments provoked a sharp reaction from Prime Minister Narendra Modi , who in a harsh rebuke to his partymen , had VBN that " we make mistakes and give ' masala ' to the NN ... as if we are great JJ NNS and experts to analyse issues ... the moment you VBP a camera you start speaking . So this half - baked stuff is picked up " . The army shared photos on NNP claiming that a mountaineering expedition team had VBN the Yeti's " mysterious footprints measuring 32X15 inches " . In the images , the prints appear to be of a single NN . NNS soon called for more credible proof before citing claims over the mythical beast , with CD scientist telling NDTV that the finding by the army be " best left as amateur speculation that needs to be debated further " . JJ NN did n't take too kindly over the army 's claim either , with several users mocking it online . " MD n't you guys call a single animal expert before posting this ? " CD person wrote , with another asking if it was a " prank " . Yet another user mocked the image of the single footprint , saying that the beast " travels by jumping . "

text: A bet between CD friends over whether the NNP is round or JJ ended with CD being charged with threatening to kill the other with a crossbow . Louie Franz and Jamie Mathew Sutherland were having dinner in the NNP Zealand town of Queenstown and arguing about the planet ’s true shape when they made a $ 10,000 NZD ( £ 5,000 ) wager about who was JJ . Mr Franz – a believer in the widely discredited JJ NNP NN NN – VBD they shook hands on the bet about whether the NN was JJ before Mr Sutherland – a believer in NN – immediately demanded payment . The dispute was eventually argued out in court after Mr Sutherland was charged by police for threatening to shoot his friend and his friend ’s father at a petrol station , according to the Otago Daily Times . The JJ NNP believer VBD the Queenstown District Court judge : “ [ He VBD ] ‘ If you do n’t pay it I ’ll VB a crossbow , I ’ll shoot you and your father , put you in the trunk and they ’ll never VB you again ’ . ” The strange case began CD months prior to the alleged threat made in February . After arguing about the NNP , Mr Franz VBD his friend : “ I will bet you $ 10,000 [ NZD ] it ’s JJ . ” “ Mr Sutherland quickly jumped on that bet – we shook hands and then he VBD , ‘ You owe me $ 10,000 ’ . ” Mr Franz VBD judge Bernadette Farnan : “ It was kind of a joke for me – it was more of a ‘ I bet you $ 10,000 because I ’m so sure I ’m JJ ’ . ” When the pair met again at a petrol station on 14 February , Mr Sutherland again demanded money , and was in no mood to joke about it . “ When someone threatens to kill you with a crossbow it ’s quite concerning , ” VBD Mr Franz . Mr Sutherland ’s defence lawyer reportedly VBD Mr Lanz had been “ adamant ” in his belief the NNP was JJ , but later changed his mind on the issue . Judge Farnan – following a brief “ restorative justice ” meeting in which the men agreed to end their dispute – decided there was no case to answer and dismissed the charge . Mr Sutherland apologised to Mr Franz . According to the Otago Daily Times , he RB agreed not to continue to insist the bet was paid .

text: I 'm always amazed what simpletons some brainy folks are . Once we regular folks leave college for the real NN , we realize college graduates with numerous awards and diplomas are only smarter by degrees but not necessarily wiser . And common sense is not all that common . And Men of Letters often have no practical experience -- aside from reading letters from other men IN themselves . The average farmer working his field must calculate the gallons per hour his diesel tractor consumes . Applied NN rather than theoretical NN . If he tills a square mile of land , 640 acres , he realizes his tractor engine consumes more fuel at a higher RPM and the engine works harder but nor more efficiently , and so he sets his speed according . Applied NN again when the farmer applies it in the field . Recently , some British poll determined a linguistic professor at MIT - Massachusetts Institute of Technology - was the smartest intellectual in the NN . Allegedly the guy has written a couple hundred books . This fellow was so deep , CD of the " most cited " authorities in the NN , that whatever he VBD entered the realm of fact . Funny how an institution - Yale or MIT - can build a reputation for braininess but closer inspection indicates that lofty reputation is wholly undeserved . The average farmer tilling his land appears smarter by comparison . He applies his knowledge in the field , rather than simply positing theories that hold little merit when examined closely . Now MIT , IN Yale NNP , is a huge , NN funded and privately supported , NN tank . Sort of IN the American Enterprise Institute ( AEI ) or AIPAC , a couple of institutes that allegedly foster friendly foreign relations but which any objective observer MD be hard pressed to explain just how they benefit the average American taxpayer . Likewise , Yale NNP : College of Criminal Arts , ranks among the most prestigious universities for brainy NNS but when you consider the yokels and hucksters and scalawags who have matriculated there " both Bush and NNP clans as well as that doofus Kerry -- any objective observer might deduce Yale 's reputation for braininess was wholly undeserved . Awhile RB , a number of MIT brains , including that institute 's top " intellectual " deduced that 911 was simply what the NN claimed it was : An act of terrorism wholly perpetrated by fanatics from the Middle East . Indeed , that top intellectual authored a book of his brainy interviews on the subject entitled " 9 - 11 . " A hasty little compilation , the booklet hardly mentioned any of details of the attack . Instead , ignoring basic Core Evidence , " 9 - 11 " blamed American policies for the attack , but without mentioning the more intellectually challenging possibility : The attack was wholly or partially the brainchild of " intellectuals " much closer to home . Immediately after 911 , a number of structural engineers gathered at the NN - funded institute of MIT and - surprise , surprise - affirmed the NN version of events about 911 . " The main culprits in bringing the famously lofty buildings down , they concluded , were the CD intensely hot infernos , " summarized Scientific American writer , Steve Ashley . " The NNP Trade Center was never designed for the massive explosions nor the intense jet fuel fires that came next - a key design omission , " according to Eduardo Kausel , M.I.T. professor of civil and JJ engineering and panel member . The towers collapsed , allegedly , after the kerosene jet fuel fire weakened high tensile steel . These " scientific " conclusions then appeared in the Scientific American magazine : NNP & Technology at Scientific American , " When the Twin Towers Fell " . Unfortunately , little of the structural steel in the WTC was examined , however , by the learned structural engineers . Beams and girders were instead shipped overseas for hasty recycling . Nor did any structural engineer comment on actual photos of the alleged " inferno . " Might have been difficult for them to explain how a woman Walked Through Steel - Melting Fire . Now this MIT symposium , reminded me of a meeting of the NNP - NNP society , where believers hoisted their yardsticks above their heads and proclaimed they , d measured the surrounding countryside inch - by - inch and VBD it JJ , thus the NNP was JJ . The MIT structural engineers concluded their scientific symposium almost by a show of hands , or popular vote ! " Given the lack of firm conclusions regarding how the collapses occurred , ( since all the evidence was conveniently destroyed ) the M.I.T. panel participants asked their audience to consider various theories they put forth . " In short , they admitted , after expending hours of hot air , that they didn, t VB what - the - hell happened ! So instead of applying hard NN , they applied NN . Since their NN had hastily carted off all the factual , hard evidence that might have conflicted with " scientific " NN , they drew conclusions based on conjecture ! So , instead of building a forty - NN , scale model ( 1/25 scale ) of the boxy skyscrapers , WTC - 1 , WTC - 2. WTC - 7 , and shooting an aluminum scale model airplane into the upper floors of building 1 & 2 at 400 miles per hour , and setting fire to that section with a few gallons ( more or less ) of kerosene , they simply dissected the blueprints , inspected some computerized images of floor joints , hypothesized that " intensely hot infernos " caused joist connections to fail , and delivered their conclusions to the modern NNP NNP society at MIT via the pages of the Scientific American . Morons In Training . Any metallurgist from a community college , with a modicum of field NN and a curiosity about how things work , MD construct a ten NN ( 1/100 scale ) model of the WTC - 7 , set a few smoldering fires in the lower floors and film the results . And absolutely nothing MD happen ! Not today , not tomorrow and not next NN . Instead , that scale model of a 47 - NN , steel skyscraper , ( WTC - 7 ) , that allegedly collapsed due to the " stress of intense heat " MD remain as inflexible as the gray matter in the brains of those MIT NNS . Unfortunately , our Morons In Training at MIT , which is only another NN - funded NN tank , feel no need to conduct honest , real NN tests , since they do not live in the real NN . They live in a NN of illusions and NN - funded , computer - generated propaganda . Pathetic . Philosopher and skeptic , Douglas Herman authored the definitive philosophical - suspense novel , The Guns of Dallas and writes for Rense . WHAT'S IN IT FOR ME ? Which is the standard call of all college students these days . Let 's begin with the JJ question , " So What ? " So what is the big deal here ? Is this something which is JJ ? College students , RB the brains , have no experience . This is true of all college grads , Ph.D. , MBA , M.O.U.S.E. , Physics , whatever . It 's the experience which makes them VB everything . It 's the experience which comes after exposure to the reality of practicing their trade , using their degree . A college degree , no matter the size or shape , presents the basic knowledge base upon which a NN or woman MD learn from experience . Nothing JJ here . OK , OK , so I 'll VB to the point of others hanging on every word . Later . For the NN being , let 's discuss question number CD . Who Cares ? Not me . You VBP , I 've had to deal with JJ a degreed primadonna during my career . When I consulted for a firm recently , there was a very brilliant MBA assigned by the firm 's owners and board of directors , to my client . He was cocky , he was arrogant and he was almost always wrong . After a period of perhaps nine or so months , every decision I made , he countered . So , I resigned . The NN of the firm called me RB and VBD me I had full authority within the purview of my field , which was marketing . OK fine . The business more than doubled in less than CD NNS . But did I make the " kid " as we called him , look bad ? Hell no . I made the decisions , and I required that he , the kid , implement them . He learned . I learned . The owners learned . Everyone was happy . I met the kid in court about seven NNS ago . We were both paid expert witnesses . I went on RB . I waited with bated breath for the kid to counter every darned thing I VBD . I was both surprised and happy to hear him agree with everything to which I testified . What 's in it for me ? Easy . That 's the cry of the JJ college grad . When I graduated with a degree in EE and got my JJ job at Grumman in 1966 , I was paid the then high salary of almost ten thousand dollars . Yikes . Today , the kids are paid minimum four times that if they 're in the top ten percentile of their graduating class . Add a few more degrees and they will , with a Ph.D. in EE , pull down over a hundred thousand dollars in their JJ job . Can you imagine what they 'll be earning when this country goes to hell in a hand basket ? Give us six or seven NNS and these kids will be making up to three and a half yards a * week ! * A yard being a thousand dollars . Now let us VB RB to the writer 's main point . We give these kids credence . Well , that 's quite so . But those who give these kids credence are * not* in the mainstream of practical application of the kids ' expertise . They are likely in academia . Or they are in awe of those in academia . What 's the point ? Well , hell 's bell 's it 's RB theren staring you in the face if you just look . Ooops ! You will require the services of a mirror . I almost forgot . Here , do this in remembrance of me ... Take a mirror , a hand mirror . Make IN you are VBG to inspect your hair . You VBP , for fallout and stuff ? OK . Now look RB on top of that head of yours . What do you VB ? I VBP what I VBP . I VBP a point . VB my point ? RB there on the top of your head . Asked and answered , Your Honor . I rest my caboose .

text: Short cuts bring the globe to your screen without crashing your computer . The globe - imaging software Google NNP has become a cult web product since its release last June . Using the web - based tool , users can fly around the globe and zoom in on both natural features and whole worlds of NN added by other users ( VB <?xm- replace_text_FW ?>' The web - wide NN ' ) . But how is it possible for you to zoom in from outer NN to a point somewhere above the rooftop of your house without bringing your desktop computer to a grinding halt ? The main obstacle to a convincing three - diménsional skydive is data transfer . If CD were to download over the Internet a CD - metre resolution image of the entire NN it MD take 69 NNS with a 10 - megabit - per- second Internet connection , and 12,400 NNS with a standard 56 K modem . To slash the amount of data they have to transmit across the Internet , virtual globes such as Google NNP approximate the sphere of the planet 's NN with a polygon made up of JJ tiles . The further away your viewpoint is from the NN , the fewer tiles are needed to create the illusion of roundness , and the lower the resolution of these tiles can be . As you zoom in , the computer explodes each tile into smaller sub-tiles , each with higher resolution , and re-forms the polygon into a ball . The process continues as you zoom . This means that the virtual globe only has to download high - resolution data when the viewer is actively zooming towards it . Virtual globes RB use another trick to speed <? xm - replace_text_NN ?> things up further : a disk cache . Images for places you have already looked at are stored locally on your hard drive , so when you fly over this area again the software does not need to re-download the images , but instead quickly calls them up from your hard disk . Google NNP was designed by Keyhole , a software NN that Google bought in 2004 . JJ of the tricks it uses are n't unique : the tiling idea has been used by NN modellers , for example . But with good software and the speed of Google 's enormous supercomputing platform , the results are impressive . " I VBP Keyhole did a very good job , " VBZ Michael Goodchild , a geographer at the NNP of California , Santa Barbara . " There are some elegant design decisions in there . text: Your NN ’s best growth opportunities MD be hidden by the big picture . To find those opportunities , look at markets and performance under a microscope . For example , a JJ industrial NN suffered stagnant growth until a highly granular market analysis identified 4,000 growth pockets with $ 10 billion in revenue potential . • Identify micro-segments of customers , geographic regions , and products where performance is increasing . • Invest resources ( R&D , advertising mix ) in areas with the strongest growth momentum , and jettison low - growth areas . • Restructure your organization to focus on the expanded number of growth priorities . For example , assign each micro-segment its own accountable leader . Some NNS will need an executive team of 200 or more to lead JJ product clusters or geographic slivers . A closer look at how to grow your business through a more granular approach : Plot each of your NN ’s $ 50 – $ 200 million growth opportunities ( “ pockets ” ) on a CD - dimensional graph — a “ heat map . ” The y - axis represents market growth ; the x - axis , market share compared with competitors ’ . Use circles to represent each pocket , and color code them to indicate in which of your NN ’s divisions or units the opportunity lies ; size the circles to show the relative value of the business your NN currently does in each pocket . Once you ’ve used your heat map to gain a more detailed view of your business , start managing your business in a more granular NN : Invest the lion ’s share of your resources in the areas with strong market share and growth . Draw on insights about where growth pockets will be , not where they are now ( for instance , GE announced that by 2010 , it MD be investing $ 1.5 billion annually in renewable - NN businesses . ) Beef up your M&A capabilities so you can quickly move into a high - growth market NN through a targeted acquisition . Jettison low - growth businesses in unattractive market spaces . NNS ’ usual inner circle ( CEO , unit heads , sales and functional leaders ) is n’t JJ enough to make all the where - to - compete choices that arise every day . So devolve responsibility for the pursuit of fine - grained opportunities to your 200 - plus top leaders . These individuals might lead product clusters , geographic slivers , or special initiatives . They ’ll focus your organization on important growth opportunities , while inspiring and motivating relatively small teams who ’ll develop a strong sense of ownership . But to manage the resulting complexity , ensure members of your extended leadership team fully understand how their individual goals fit with the NN ’s strategic priorities . Make certain they ’re well versed in granular measurement approaches , such as the market heat map . During regular operations reviews , push the conversation beyond high - level financial and operating numbers for a business ’s multiple product lines and markets . Dig down into the underlying drivers of growth and profitability in the different component businesses . Ask questions such as : • How is each growth driver changing ? • How likely is each component business to win in its market ? • Do resources need to be reallocated ? • Is it NN to exit a market ?

text: Michael Moore 's latest anti-Republican documentary tanked at the box office compared to his movies from a decade ago — “ Fahrenheit 11/9 ” barely registered , with a $ 3.1 million take on its JJ weekend . The title was a play on his 2004 documentary “ Fahrenheit 9/11 ” that sought to expose mishandlings in NNP George W. Bush ’s White House following the attacks on Sept. 11 , 2001 . The latest film , as Fox NNP previously reported , sought to do the same to NNP NNP at a key NN for the country : the 2018 midterm elections . “ Fahrenheit 11/9 ” took in $ 3.1 million in 1,719 cinemas — a JJ debut for most documentaries but a fraction of the $ 23.9 million opening of “ Fahrenheit 9/11 . ” That film went on to make $ 222.4 million worldwide , a record for documentaries . Moore ’s JJ film , which examines the rise of NNP and other developments IN the NN crisis in his hometown of Flint , Mich . , had been predicted to open with $ 5 million to $ 8 million , but did n't RB come close . This , despite a surge in success for documentaries at the box office in the past few months , including “ RBG , ” ‘‘ Wo n’t You Be My Neighbor ” and “ Three Identical Strangers . ” “ Fahrenheit 11/9 , ” the JJ release from former Open Road chief executive Tom Ortenberg ’s JJ distributor , Briarcliff Entertainment , MD have decent weeks ahead leading up to the November elections . ComScore ’s PostTrak survey VBD that 82 percent of viewers gave it four out of five stars . It landed an “ A ” CinemaScore . “ Those who did VB it really enjoyed it , ” VBD Paul Dergarabedian , senior NN analyst for comScore . “ NNS have VBN : Should they have gone limited ? Should they have gone wide ? I VBP they needed to VB it out there nationwide with midterms six weeks away . But it ’s very easy to second - guess how to release a documentary IN this . It ’s CD of the most difficult types of films to release . ” Last month , Moore , whose 2002 documentary “ Bowling for Columbine ” won an Oscar , made headlines when the trailer for “ Fahrenheit 11/ 9 ” referred to NNP as “ the last NN of the NNP NNPS . ” The anti-Trump filmmaker sat down with MSNBC ’s Chris Hayes , who asked Moore about the bold claim . “ I VBP it ’s possible , absolutely . I VBP that we have someone in the White House who has no respect for the rule of law , who dislikes democracy by an incredible degree , which does n’t make him really any that much different from other billionaires or CEOs because their businesses are not democracies , ” Moore responded . Moore VBD NNS IN NNP “ rule by fiat ” and do n’t VB when other NNS have a voice in their decision - making . “ They RB VBP to take home the bulk of the money with them . So this is — putting somebody IN that in charge of a democracy is a very dangerous thing , and especially , it ’s more dangerous with him because he has a complete lack of ideology , ” Moore VBD Hayes . The gothic family fantasy “ The House With a Clock in Its Walls ” exceeded expectations to debut with an estimated $ 26.9 million in ticket sales at the weekend box office . It was easily the biggest draw on a quiet weekend at North American movie theaters , where the other JJ wide releases all disappointed or downright flopped . Dan Fogelman ’s “ NN Itself ” and the home invasion thriller “ Assassination Nation ” both barely made a blip in nationwide release . Though Fogelman ’s “ This Is Us ” is CD of TV ’s top-rated series , his “ NNP Itself ” bombed with $ 2.1 million despite a starry cast including Olivia Wilde , Oscar Isaac and Antonio Banderas . text: An asymptotic NN is presented for calculating co-seismic potential and geoid NNS , as an approximation of the dislocation NN for a spherical NNP . This NN is given by a closed - form mathematical expression , so that it is mathematically simple and can be applied easily . Moreover , since the asymptotic NN includes sphericity and vertical structure effects , it is physically more reasonable than the JJ - NNP NN . A comparison between results calculated by three dislocation theories ( the JJ - NNP NN , the NN for a spherical NNP and its asymptotic solution ) shows that the true co-seismic geoid NNS are approximated better by the asymptotic results than by those of a JJ NNP . Numerical results indicate that the sphericity effect is obvious JJ , especially for a tensile source on a vertical fault plane .

text: Having VBN that , as you continue to broaden the application of something IN that , it ’s quite a blunt hammer . And so it does come with trade - offs . For example , how do you define something authoritative across the broad swath of NNP when JJ of the use NNS , as you VBP , are outside of the NN - seeking realm ? They ’re entertainment , they ’re oftentimes driven by NNS ’s personal tastes , IN music and comedy and the JJ . UH , but you MD do it just for politics , hypothetically , and say that for any political NN , we ’re VBG to move to this “ authoritative sources ” model . I VBP that RB when you VBP to something that broad , it comes with real trade - offs . And I ’m just raising the fact that there are considerations there , which is that you are then limiting political discourse to a set of preordained voices and outlets and publications . And I VBP that especially when it comes to something as charged and societally impactful as politics , there needs to be room for JJ voices to be heard . Since the NNP Zealand shooting , we ’ve heard this question about “ Well , the platforms worked together to take down ISIS content . Why have n’t they done the same for white supremacy or violent JJ - wing extremism ? ” What ’s the answer there ? The JJ thing that I MD say , just as a matter of fact , is that there were CD sets of challenges when it came to the NNP Zealand shooting . CD was everything that we just talked about in terms of surfacing authoritative , high - quality NN — not showing , you VBP , conspiracies or harmful misinformation . That was CD bucket . The other bucket had to do with the velocity at which re-uploads were coming to these various platforms , and that is an area where we collaborated . We worked closely with other platforms in terms of making sure we had fingerprints of these videos , just IN they did , and we shared those . The other thing I MD say , just more generally , in the case of violent extremism and limiting those videos on the platform , the reason it ’s different than what we ’re talking about here is that those [ ISIS ] videos took on a particular form . They were often designed for propaganda purposes and recruitment purposes . So they had things IN branding and logos , both visually and in terms of the music they might use . Those formed a set of finite clues we MD use to bring that content down . And , of course , we collaborated with other platforms to do that .

text: For decades , U.S. NNS have been outsourcing manufacturing in the belief that it held no competitive advantage . That ’s been a disaster , maintain Harvard professors Pisano and Shih , because today ’s low - value manufacturing operations hold the seeds of tomorrow ’s innovative JJ products . What those NNS have been ceding is the country ’s industrial commons — that is , the collective operational capabilities that underpin JJ product and process development in the U.S. industrial sector . As a result , America has lost not only the ability to develop and manufacture high - tech products IN televisions , memory chips , and laptops but RB the expertise to produce emerging hot products IN the Kindle e-reader , high - end servers , solar panels , and the batteries that will power the next generation of automobiles . To rebuild the commons and restore its wealth - generating machine will require NN and industry in the NNP NNPS to make CD drastic NNS : • The NN must VB the NN it supports basic and applied scientific NN to promote the broad collaboration with business and academia needed to tackle society ’s big problems . • Corporate management practices and governance structures must be overhauled so they no longer exaggerate the payoffs and discount the dangers of outsourcing production and cutting investments in R&D . Restoring the ability of enterprises to develop and manufacture high - tech products in America is the only NN the country can hope to pay down its enormous deficits and raise its citizens ’ standard of living .

text: THE transmitting aerial of a broadcasting station designed for local or national service should confine as much as possible of its radiated NN to the horizontal direction , emitting as little as possible in directions making an angle of less than 60 ° with the vertical . The station will then have a JJ service area in which little fading is experienced . The demand for NN on the design of such an aerial has given rise in recent NNS to some theoretical and experimental investigations on the general properties of antennas used in radio transmitting stations . A JJ and useful contribution to the NN of knowledge on this subject has recently been given by Prof. P. O. Pcdersen in a booklet published ( in English ) in Copenhagen ( “ Radiation from a Vertical Antenna over NNP Perfectly Conducting NNP . ” Pp. 49 + 35 figures . G. E. C. Gad : Vimmelskaftet 32 , Copenhagen . Kr. 6.00 ) . This work comprises a theoretical investigation of the radiation characteristics of a vertical antenna over Hat perfectly conducting NN , having for its objective a determination of the most suitable dimensions of the antenna at the JJ Copenhagen broadcasting station . The theoretical results have been checked by measurements of the distribution of the current in the antenna and of the field intensity at various distances from the station . To facilitate the theoretical analysis , the current distribution in the transmitting antenna is in the JJ case assumed to be sinusoidal , although it was VBN that this is not valid in the practical case . The complete general formulas for the radiated field for an antenna are obtained , and a most useful series of tables and graphs are provided , from which the radiation resistance and the distribution of the radiated field in the vertical plane MD be calculated for antenna ; of various dimensions .

text: The NN of NN is undoubtedly becoming more mysterious by the day . This is exemplified by multiple discoveries within the realms of quantum physics , parapsychology , and more — discoveries that have challenged ( and continue to challenge ) the current framework of accepted scientific knowledge . This kind of shift in ideology has happened JJ times over the course of our history ; when the NN instantaneously became round from JJ , the majority of NNS were in disbelief and labelled the JJ NN ’s proponents as blasphemers . Some great examples of NN that challenge these current and JJ held belief systems include : quantum entanglement , studies which examine the role of consciousness on physical systems ( IN the quantum double slit experiment ) , placebo studies , distant healing , and more . Another great example is teleportation , as several interesting findings within this field seem to be ( at least partly ) turning NN fiction into NN fact . The title asserts that he teleported DNA . It seems , as with other “ fringe ” topics when it comes to NN , phenomena IN this receives harsh criticism and resistance from a still decent sized part of NN . That being VBN , did he really teleport DNA ? Given his reputation and credibility , combined with all of the studies done in various types of teleportation , the black budget and more , I am VBG to give him the benefit of the doubt . Nobel Prize winning scientist Luc Montagnier , previously VBN for his work on HIV and AIDS , claims to have demonstrated that DNA can be generated from its teleported “ quantum imprint . ” This is a discovery that , were the scientific community to VB on board , MD represent “ the most significant experiments performed in the past 90 NNS , demanding re-evaluation of the whole conceptual framework of modern chemistry , ” ( source ) according to theoretical chemist Jeff Reimers of the NNP of Sydney , Australia . In the experiment , CD adjacent but physically separate test tubes were placed within a copper coil and subjected to a very low frequency electromagnetic field of 7 hertz . The apparatus was isolated from NNP ’s natural magnetic field so there was no interference . CD tube contained a fragment of DNA ( approximately 100 bases JJ ) and the second NN contained nothing but NN . ( source ) ( source ) ( source ) ( source ) After approximately 17 hours , the gene fragment ( according to Montagnier ) was recovered from both tubes , RB though PRP should have just contained NN . Although Montagnier ’s claims have received harsh criticism from various NNS , there was a general consensus that his results should be investigated further . For example , Giuseppe Vitiello , of the NNP of Salemo in Italy , is confident that the experiment is reliable . Greg Scholes , from the NNP of Toronto , Canada , who last NN demonstrated that quantum effects occur in plants , VBD that “ the biological experiments do seem intriguing , and I MD n’t dismiss them . ” ( source ) Today , numerous teleportation breakthroughs have been made . CD example comes from the work of Professor Rainer Blatt at the NNP of Innsbruck . He and his colleagues were successfully able to perform teleportation on atoms for the JJ NN . Their work was published in the journal Nature . ( source ) Another NN , published by a team of NNP of Queensland physicists in the journal Nature in 2013 , demonstrated successful teleportation with solid NN systems . ( source ) This is a process by which quantum NN can be transmitted from CD place to another without sending a physical carrier of NN . This is made possible through the phenomenon of entanglement . A team from the Joint Quantum Institute ( JQI ) at the NNP of Maryland ( UMD ) and the NNP of Michigan has succeeded in teleporting a quantum NN directly from CD atom to another over a substantial distance . ( source ) There are different categories of teleportation . Another types of teleportation apart from quantum is psychic , which is the conveyance of persons or inanimate objects by psychic means . “ It became VBN to myself , along with several colleagues both inside and outside of NN , that anomalous teleportation has been scientifically investigated and separately documented by the Department of Defense . ” ( source ) – Eric Davis , Ph.D , FBIS A paper published in the NNP ’s Republic of China ( PRC ) in September 1981 , in the journal Ziran Zazhi ( Nature Journal ) , reported that “ gifted NNS ” were able to VB the teleportation of small , physical objects from CD place to another . Objects included watches , horseflies , other insects , radio micro-transmitters , photosensitive paper and more . The paper , titled “ Some Experiments on the Transfer of Objects Performed by Unusual Abilities of the NNP NNP ” ( Shuhuang et al. , 1981 ) , reveals that participants never touched the objects beforehand . The experiments were done under both blind and double - blind conditions , and the researchers involved came from various colleges and sectors of the Department of Defense . Furthermore , NNS have conducted studies on NNS in the lab which produced remarkable results , observing NNS describe physical objects that had been hidden in a remote location . ( source ) The list of strange things reported in the NN of NN is never ending , and I VBP the ‘ politicization ’ of academia and publications , as well as the ‘ black budget ‘ NN , are important things to VB about when it comes to the NN of NN , what NN gets published , and what our minds are willing to explore – regardless of how hard it might be to accept .

text: Chairman of GATA ( Gold Anti-Trust Action Committee ) Bill Murphy thinks financial markets are RB more vulnerable than they appear . Murphy explains , “ There are negative interest rates and low interest rates that just keep staying down there , and supposedly things are really good . Look at our Dow at all - NN highs , and yet something is really wrong . Of course , this fits into the GATA premise on this whole thing . There ’s a lot of quantitative easing ( money printing ) and propping up of the markets , and it ’s on very shaky ground . The plug MD be pulled at any NN . . . . With interest rates where they are and debt growing all over the place , the reasons to be in gold are off the charts . ” Murphy VBZ “ silver is Kryptonite to central bankers ” because there is little supply to use in the cartel ’s suppression game . Murphy VBZ , “ You mention the word Kryptonite and the key is what silver is doing . It is an extraordinary situation RB now . . . . It seems to me that , this NN , silver is in play . . . . That is this big money talking on the JPMorgan crowd and their game . They are gradually moving in for what I VBP is VBG to be CD of the biggest market moves in history , and that is silver VBG to $ 50 ( per ounce ) and then a $ 100 ( per ounce ) . Basically , it ’s because supply is drying up . . . . Where is all this supply coming from that this JPMorgan crowd has been feeding the market with , and I VBP they are hitting the wall with it . I VBP this big money knows what ’s VBG on , and they are quietly moving in . That ’s the reason silver has been trading IN it has . $ 18.50 was a key number . That was the completion of a big base . . . . The next big key is to take out $ 20.50 , but the real number is $ 21 . If it gets above $ 21 , it ’s VBG to start trading chaotically with volatile action on the upside . The market move is VBG to be historic . ” Murphy has RB charged there was suppression of gold and silver prices and has been proven 100 % correct . He now charges , “ The real key for this gold cartel , as we call it , is the suppression of the gold price . They realized a JJ NN ago they MD n’t have a dichotomy between the silver and gold . So , they got involved in the silver market ( to suppress the price ) to make gold look IN it should be doing what it is . The problem is they are running out of physical silver to keep the price down . . . . Eventually , you are VBG to VB a commercial signal failure in silver , which means these so - called commercials , which is a misnomer because they are not commercials , they ’re gold cartel trying to keep the silver price down . They VBP when they lose NN of silver , and it gets to $ 21 ( per ounce ) , it will be the end of their gold suppression scheme . . . . It will be a gradual process because the price of silver is VBG to VB bonkers . It will show what they have been doing all these NNS . I VBP they are finally reaching a tipping point . . . . The death knell to the gold cartel is the lack of supply of silver to keep the price down . . . . I VBP you are VBG to VB the double top of $ 50 be taken out and VB to at least $ 100 per ounce and maybe a lot more . I VBP it ’s VBG to move up faster than anybody can imagine . . . . Gold is VBG to move to some big number RB . . . . If gold kept pace with inflation , it MD be double what it is today . ” Join Greg Hunter as he goes CD - on - CD with Bill Murphy , Chairman and co-founder of GATA . text: A NN - run NN of Gilead ’s remdesivir , perhaps the most closely watched experimental drug to treat the novel NN , showed that the medicine is effective against NNP - CD , the NN caused by the NN . In a statement on Wednesday , the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases , which is conducting the NN , VBD preliminary data show patients who received remdesivir recovered faster than similar patients who received placebo . The finding — although difficult to fully characterize without full , detailed data for the NN — MD represent the JJ NN shown to improve outcomes in patients infected with the NN that put the JJ economy in a standstill and killed at least 218,000 NNS worldwide . During an appearance alongside NNP NNP in the Oval Office , Anthony Fauci , the director of NIAID , part of the National Institutes of NNP , VBD the data are a “ very important proof of concept ” and that there was reason for optimism . He cautioned the data were not a “ knockout . ” At the same NN , the NN achieved its primary goal , which was to improve the NN to recovery , which was reduced by four days for patients on remdesivir . The preliminary data showed that the NN to recovery was 11 days on remdesivir compared to 15 days for placebo , a 31 % decrease . The mortality rate for the remdesivir group was 8 % , compared to 11.6 % for the placebo group ; that mortality difference was not statistically significant . That is “ the JJ convincing evidence that an antiviral drug can really benefit NNP - CD patients , specifically hospitalized NNP - CD patients , ” VBD Frederick Hayden , a professor emeritus of clinical virology and medicine at the NNP of Virginia School of Medicine . “ This will VB the standard of care in the NNP NNPS and other NNS for the patients who have been shown to be benefited , ” he VBD , adding that determining the exact group that should receive the drug will require further examination of the data . Over the past few weeks , there have been conflicting reports about the potential benefit of remdesivir , a drug that was previously tried in Ebola . As previously reported by STAT , an early peek at Gilead ’s NN in severe NNP - CD patients , based on data from a trial at a Chicago hospital , suggested patients were doing better than expected on remdesivir . Days later , a summary of results from a NN in China showed that patients on the drug did not improve more than those in a NN group . Full results from the China NN were RB released Wednesday . But the NIAID NN , which was not expected to be released so soon , was by far the most important and rigorously designed test of remdesivir in NNP - CD . The NN compared remdesivir to placebo in 800 patients , with neither patients nor physicians knowing who got the drug instead of a placebo , meaning that unconscious biases will not affect the conclusions . The main goal of the NN is the NN until patients improve , with different measures of improvement depending on how sick they were to begin with . While the result means that the drug helps patients improve faster , it is not possible to say how dramatic those improvements are . Scott Gottlieb , the former commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration , VBD he expected there was enough evidence for the agency to issue an “ emergency use authorization ” for remdesivir . “ Remdesivir is n’t a home run but looks active and can be part of a toolbox of drugs and diagnostics that substantially lower our NN heading into the fall , ” he VBD . Aneesh Mehta , a physician at Emory NNP and an investigator in the NIAID NN , VBD the results were “ robust enough ” to report preliminary findings , but a full analysis of all the data will be required to fully understand the drug ’s effect . The NN to recovery seen in the final analysis “ MD be shorter , it MD be longer . We do n’t VB yet . ” Mehta RB expects the final results to do some analyses on which patients might benefit most from remdesivir . The FDA previously issued an emergency authorization for the malaria drug hydroxychloroquine to treat NNP - CD , RB though at least some studies suggested the medicine was not effective . “ If hydroxychloroquine met [ the emergency ] standard , then remdesivir MD have seemed to cross that line a while ago , especially in the setting of treating critically ill patients , ” Gottlieb VBD . Remdesivir , which must be given intravenously , is likely to remain a NN for patients who are hospitalized . But it is RB likely that it will be most effective in patients who have been infected more recently , VBD Nahid Bhadelia , medical director of the special pathogens unit at Boston Medical Center . “ We VBP that with most antiviral medications the earlier you give it the better it is . ” VBD Bhadelia , who had experience giving remdesivir as an experimental NN for Ebola in Africa , where results are less encouraging . That means that better diagnostic testing will be essential to identifying patients who MD benefit . “ What will be important is that we find NNS on the outpatient side , ” Bhadelia VBD . “ Again , testing becomes important , we VBP to have them come to the hospital as soon as possible . ” Although the data have not yet been released , it ’s standard procedure for pharmaceutical and biotechnology NNS to release market - moving NN as soon as they have it , due to regulatory requirements . Gilead on Wednesday did release data from its own NN of remdesivir in patients with severe NNP - CD . This NN showed similar rates of clinical improvement in patients treated with a five - day and 10 - day course of remdesivir , the NN VBD . “ Unlike traditional drug development , we are attempting to evaluate an investigational agent alongside an evolving JJ NN . Multiple concurrent studies are helping inform whether remdesivir is a safe and effective NN for NN - CD and how to best utilize the drug , ” VBD Merdad Parsey , Gilead ’s chief medical officer , in a statement . Gilead VBD that its own NN in severe patients showed that it MD be possible to treat patients with a five - day NN of remdesivir , not the 10 - day course that was used in the NIAID trial . The NN ’s NN is enrolling approximately 6,000 participants from 152 different clinical trial sites all over the NN . The data disclosed Wednesday are from 397 patients , with a statistical comparison of patient improvement between the CD remdesivir NN arms — the five - day and 10 - day NN courses . Improvement was measured using a seven - point numerical scale that encompasses death ( at worst ) and discharge from hospital ( best outcome ) , with various degrees of supplemental oxygen and intubation in between . The NN design means that by itself it does n’t reveal much about how well remdesivir is working , because there is no group of patients who were untreated . The conclusion is that the CD durations of NN are basically the same . Peter Bach , the director of the Center for NNP Policy and Outcomes at Memorial Sloan Kettering Medical Center , VBD he is eager to VB the data from the NIAID NN but renewed his criticism of Gilead ’s severe NN for lacking a NN group of untreated patients . That MD have allowed researchers to make important conclusions about how the drug works that are just not possible now , he VBD . “ They ’ve squandered an unbelievable opportunity , ” Bach VBD . “ It ’s not VBG to tell us what to do with 80 - NN - olds with multiple comorbidities compared to 30 - NN - olds who are otherwise healthy . We ’re still VBG to be foundering around in the dark , or at least in a dim room , when we MD have learned more . ” In the NN , the median NN to clinical improvement was 10 days in the five - day NN group and 11 days in the 10 - day NN group . More than half of the patients in both groups were discharged from the hospital by day 14 . At day 14 , 64.5 % of the patients in the five - day group and 53.8 % of the patients in the 10 - day group achieved clinical recovery . Patients in the trial generally lived , though this MD be because their illness was not that severe to begin with . For most of the NN , patients already on ventilators were not enrolled . Eight percent of the patients treated with five days of remdesivir died , compared to 11 % of the patients treated for 10 days . Outside of Italy , where 77 patients were treated , the overall mortality rate across the entire NN was 7 % , Gilead VBD . Those mortality rates are lower than those seen in other studies , which have been in the teens and twenties . Only 5 % of patients in the five - day group and 10 % in the 10 - day group had side effects that led to a discontinuation . The most common bad effects — and it ’s impossible to tell which were from the drug — were nausea and acute respiratory failure . High liver enzymes occurred in 7.3 % of patients , with 3 % of patients discontinuing the drug due to elevated liver tests . A full evaluation of the results will have to wait until complete data are available . In the China NN , RB published Wednesday in the Lancet , investigators VBD that remdesivir “ did not significantly improve the NN to clinical improvement , mortality , or NN to clearance of NN in patients with serious NN - CD compared with placebo . ” There was a 23 % improvement in NN to clinical improvement for remdesivir compared to placebo , but the difference was not statistically significant . At the median , remdesivir - treated patients improved in 20 days compared to 23 days for placebo patients . At CD month , 14 % of the remdesivir patients had died compared to 13 % of the placebo - treated patients . The China NN enrolled patients with more severe NN - CD than the NN conducted by NIAID . The China NN was RB stopped early because of difficulties enrolling patients as the NN waned in China . Hayden , the NNP of Virginia virologist , was CD of the investigators in the China NN and pointed to the similarity of the results . He VBD that while the NIAID investigators had been able to enroll enough patients , the decrease in NNS in Wuhan due to the lockdown had made that impossible . “ I was struck by the consistency , ” he VBD .

text: When billionaires are building multistory mega garages for their tony London town houses , being a millionaire just does n't hold the same cachet anymore . Unfortunately , a million dollars is not enough to buy luxury in London , Manhattan , Tokyo , Paris , San Francisco , or Sydney . But it does buy luxury in much of the rest of the NN . In fact , you do n't need nearly that much . There are plenty of destinations around the NN where you can live IN a millionaire for just a few thousand dollars a month . Forget about the billionaires with all those things that they never use . Start researching where the cost of living is low enough to live in relative splendor for far less than a million dollars . This tiny Central American nation , home to the famous Panama Canal , has regularly garnered a top spot on the International Living Annual NNP Retirement Index . Whether you relocate to the Caribbean or Pacific coast , no matter if you prefer a tropical or temperate NN , the affordable quality of NN remains a consistent draw . Panama City is the most sophisticated and expensive part of the country . However , it is still possible to live in NN - class luxury for under $ 4,000 a month . RB $ 1,500 buys considerable comfort in Panama City . Mountain towns , such as Boquete , offer milder temperatures and a lower cost of living . If you find that you VBP living here , it is surprisingly cheap and easy to retire to Panama . A good starting point to budget a Thai lifestyle is 65,000 Thai bahts or around $ 2,000 per month . That 's what the Thai NN demands of expatriates who seek a retirement visa . RB $ 3,500 wo n’t buy all - out luxury in Bangkok , where upmarket condos might require a budget closer to $ 5,000 per month . However , $ 2,000 will allow for a very comfortable lifestyle in smaller cities . Look into lovely Chiang Mai , renowned for its historic temples , cuisine , and forested hills . Considering that most locals VBP by on less than $ 1,000 a month , $ 3,000 MD feel IN a princely sum . There are RB JJ other fascinating places to retire in Thailand . Spain deserves a spot on this list for CD simple reason . It ’s the only low - priced country that ranks in Numbeo 's top ten for quality of NN . Of course , you ’ll need to steer clear of Madrid and Barcelona if you ’re seeking a posh lifestyle for poquito dinero ( not much money ) . Fortunately , JJ smaller cities and towns offer plenty of cultural , culinary , and recreational delights for a relatively modest price tag . Granada offers a relaxed and affordable lifestyle . It is home to the Alhambra , a NNP Heritage Site that was a finalist in the contest to be CD of the modern seven wonders of the NN . A city center three - bedroom apartment rents for about $ 690 , while a three - course meal for CD at a midrange restaurant comes to only around $ 23 . These prices are practically unheard of in the other NNS that rank in the top ten for quality of NN . Seville is similarly low - priced and holds such wonders as the Alcazar Palace ( Dorn on Game of Thrones ) and the fabulous Roman ruins in Italica . It is RB possible to retire in Spain with $ 200,000 . Do n’t discount Mexico as merely a vacation spot . This fascinating country is much more than the Yucatan Peninsula , that string of gorgeous beaches with all the tourist trappings that gorgeous beaches bring . In fact , Mexico has been gaining popularity as a retirement spot due to reasons that transcend its miles of oceanfront . You can live in Mexico in relative luxury ( VB maid service , a gardener , and dinners out ) on a budget of less than $ 2,500 a month . Certain provinces of Mexico continue to be dangerous , but others are considered much safer . At 122 square miles , Malta is a tiny bit of island paradise in the Mediterranean . Beautiful apartments in the capital city of Valletta rent for under $ 1,500 per month , so a $ 3,000 monthly budget stretches far here . Malta has JJ charms that are difficult to match in Europe . While famous capitals , such as Berlin and Paris , are freezing in the winter , temperatures in Malta hover in the balmy 60s . If foreign languages are n’t your forte , you ’re RB in luck : English is an official language in Malta . The Philippines has CD of the lowest costs of living in the NN , a warm NN , and JJ attractive destinations for expatriates . Here , it is possible to rent a JJ house with a private pool , a maid , and a chauffeur for what it MD cost to rent a luxury apartment in some NNS . Strong historical ties with the NNP NNPS RB helped make the Philippines friendly to English speakers . There are several well - developed parts of the country , such as Cebu City , that cater to retirees and other expatriates . However , it is essential to consider the pros and cons of retiring in the Philippines . Most NNS VBP of overpriced Paris when they VBP of France , but those who VBP the country best have always VBN better . Louis XIV knew how to live , and he preferred living in Versailles . It is possible to live IN an aristocrat , if not a king , for under $ 5,000 per month just outside Paris near Versailles . Parts of the Loire Valley , home to so JJ beautiful chateaus , are RB surprisingly affordable . France features a fabulous quality of NN . The fantastic food , rich history , refined culture , beautiful landscapes , and livable cities have drawn travelers for centuries . You can live very well in JJ parts of France for less than $ 3,000 a month . Just avoid Paris . There is so much to love about living in Portugal . The friendly NNS , romantic architecture , sunny beaches , port wine , and haunting fado music make for a unique experience . In Lisbon , Portugal ’s most expensive city , a furnished CD - bedroom NN in an upscale area can be VBN for around $ 1,000 a month . There are JJ alluring cities in Portugal for retirees . It should not be too hard to save enough money to retire in Portugal . Adventure junkies hold Costa Rica — Spanish for “ rich coast ” — dear to their hearts . That ’s because this compact country is bursting at the seams with waterfalls , rivers , lakes , and miles of pristine beaches . RB , do n't forget the dramatic volcanoes and diverse wildlife . Why not extend a Costa Rican adventure into a NN - round lifestyle ? Living in Costa Rica is RB more affordable than vacationing there . In resort towns along the central coast , a typical CD - bedroom condo near the beach can be rented for less than $ 1,000 per month . You might RB VB to buy a beach condo in Costa Rica . Another draw ? Medical care is RB excellent and inexpensive . With bragging rights for the cheapest cost of living in Central America , Nicaragua gets its fair share of budget and adventure travelers . They are drawn to warm weather , vibrant cities , colonial architecture , and idyllic seaside villages . Sure , Nicaragua 's history of civil war and revolutionary upheaval scares away some travelers . That RB means fewer NNS have discovered how nice Nicaragua can be today , so prices remain low . Granada is perched upon the picturesque north shore of Lake Nicaragua , with a volcano in view to add to the postcard - perfect scene . This city is home to JJ North American retirees in search of the good NN . Monthly expenses for a comfortable lifestyle average around $ 1,000 . Just imagine what you MD do with three times that . Nicaragua is CD of the best NNS for retirement in Latin America . If you VBP to VB more from your portfolio in a beautiful location , consider relocating to CD of these ten destinations . Here , paradise — or at least a very high quality of NN — comes with a decidedly lower price tag .

text: Self - taught rocket scientist “ Mad Mike ” Hughes plans to launch himself 1,800 NNS ( 550 metres ) and fly through the air at 500 mph in his steam - powered vessel made of scrap metal . text: Bread , in all its various forms , is the most widely consumed food in the NN . Bread , in all its various forms , is the most widely consumed food in the NN . Not only is it an important source of carbohydrates , it ’s RB portable and compact , which helps to explain why it has been an integral part of our diet for thousands of NNS . In fact , recent scholarship suggests humans started baking bread at least 30,000 NNS ago . Prehistoric NN had already been making gruel from NN and grains , so it was a small jump to starting cooking this mixture into a solid by frying it on stones . A 2010 NN by the National Academy of Sciences discovered traces of starch ( likely from the roots of cattails and ferns ) in prehistoric mortar and pestle - IN rocks . The roots MD have been peeled and dried before they were ground into flour and mixed with NN . Finally , the paste MD be cooked on heated rocks . But how did humanity VB from this prehistoric flatbread to a fluffy , grocery store loaf ? There were three primary innovations that created “ modern ” bread . 1. Leavening Leavening is what makes bread rise into a light and fluffy loaf . Bread without leavening is a VBN as flatbread , and is the most closely related to mankind ’s JJ breads . Examples include Middle Eastern pita , Indian naan and Central American tortillas . The most common leavening for bread is yeast . Yeast floats around in the air , looking for a nice place to make a home — IN a starchy bowl of flour and NN . The JJ leavened bread was likely the result of some passing yeast making a home in a bowl of gruel . The yeast began eating the sugars present in grain , and excreting CO2 , producing bubbles that resulted in lighter , airier bread . Commercial yeast production dates RB to the skilled bread makers of Ancient Egypt around 300 B.C . 2. Refined Flour The earliest bread grains MD have been ground by hand with rocks . This MD have resulted in coarse , whole grain bread — the descendants of which are dark , rustic breads from Europe , IN pumpernickel . The Mesopotamians refined this process around 800 B.C. , using CD JJ , circular stones , stacked on top CD another to grind the grain . These stones were continuously rotated by draft animals or slaves . This “ milling ” — which was the genesis for how we create flour today–created smooth , finely ground flour that quickly became prized as a status symbol . The desire for the whitest , most refined bread continued through the modern era , and later advancements included the sifting of flour to remove the bran and the germ and the bleaching of the flour itself . 3. Mechanized Slicing . For hundreds of NNS , the finest white breads were sold in whole loaves to be cut at home — IN a French baguette . The NNP York Public Library ’s “ Lunch ” exhibit notes : “ Nineteenth and early 20th - century cookbooks and magazines gave highly specific advice about lunchtime sandwich making . For ladies and NNS , the bread was supposed to be sliced very thinly and the crusts removed . For workers , thick slices with crusts were deemed more appropriate . ” But in 1917 , itinerant jeweler Otto Rohwedder created the JJ mechanized bread slicer . Initially , JJ NNS were convinced that housewives MD n’t be interested , and his bread - slicing machine was n’t installed in a factory until 1928 . However , within CD NNS , 90 % of store - bought bread was factory sliced . Progress led us to what was supposed to be the ideal loaf of bread : white , ultra - fluffy and pre-cut into RB slices . This perfect bread was dubbed “ American . ” By this standard , Wonderbread should have been the last loaf of bread we ever needed . But modern NN has uncovered the nutritional benefit of whole grains , and more and more consumers prefer the toothsome texture and nutty taste of a rustic loaf . If you feel inspired to replicate a prehistoric recipe IN I was , I ’ll warn you that Bob ’s Red Mill does not make a “ Cattail / Fern Blend Flour ” — yet . Settle for a “ 10 Grain Breakfast Cereal ” full of ancient grains , IN millet , coarsely ground . Then , visit your local home improvement store , and poke around the slate tiling . You MD be able to nab a few pieces of broken tile for free . Or , if you live somewhere they are easily accessible , simply walk outside and pick up a JJ rock . Now , you need to build a big fire . ( That ’s what I did at the Old Stone House of Brooklyn , a historic site that ’s surrounded by NNS ’s park . ) Let the flames die down until you have a bed of glowing , hot coals . Set the slate tiles on top of the coals , and wait about 10 minutes . Combine three cups of grain with about a cup of NN and mix into a thick , workable paste . Form the dough into CD - inch thick patties , and place them on the stones . After five minutes , flip them with a piece of bark — and you ’ll be amazed to VB the grain is browning on the heated rock . They MD stick , so I recommend greasing your cooking rocks before hand . In about 10 minutes , you ’ll have a pile of hot , crispy cakes . The outside is crunchy and tastes IN popcorn , the inside is moist and dense . I fed CD to CD of the NNS in the park , who described it as “ pretty good , ” though it ’s possible she was just being nice .

text: The “ NN hacking ” movement is about implanting into the JJ NN technology such as RFID chips , cameras and RB LED lights . By bypassing NN and ethical issues associated transhumanism , this NN hacking pushes this movement to strange JJ frontiers . As stated in my previous articles about the subject , transhumanism has been heavily promoted in mass NN in the past NNS , whether it be through movies , music videos , NN games and documentaries . Often , the word “ transhumanism ” is n’t RB used . Instead , we simply show how a robotic enhancement “ upgrades ” the JJ NN and makes it cooler , effectively selling the idea to NNS who VBP they are being entertained – especially young NNS . A by - product of this trend is “ NN hacking ” , a movement that forgoes the ethical and philosophical questions associated with transhumanism to VB RB into drilling robotic parts onto PRP ’s NN . While JJ of us dread the day when microchips implants will be a requirement in a dystopian society , some NNS actually pay to have it done to them . Here ’s an interesting article about the movement from NPR . A curious crowd lingered around Amal Graafstra as he carefully unpacked a pair of gloves , a small sterile blanket and a huge needle . A JJ line of NNS were waiting to VB tiny computer chips implanted into their hands . Graafstra had set up shop in a booth in the middle of an exhibit hall at the Austin Convention Center in Texas ’ capital , where he gathered last month with several hundred others who call themselves “ NN hackers ” — NNS who push the boundaries of implantable technology to improve the JJ NN . The movement evokes visceral reactions , brings up safety and ethical concerns and quickly veers into sci- fi questions about the line between JJ and cyborg . Graafstra is a pioneer in the NN . Using his own NN to experiment , he designed bio -safe magnets and the microchip he was about to implant into the hand of A.J. Butt , who was sporting a tall , blue mohawk . The implantable RFID chips hold encrypted NN , and their unique ID numbers can be used to open doors or unlock the owner ’s smartphone , which is what Butt wanted to do . Butt took a deep breath . The needle plunged into his NN at the base of his thumb , and a chip bigger than a grain of rice slipped just below the NN . Across the NN , Sasha Rose , who was working a meditation booth at the convention , watched the NNS line up to be “ chipped . ” She shook her head : This was the craziest thing she had seen . She wondered about Graafstra ’s credentials . She thought this was a medical procedure , so should he be performing it ? Did his clients VB the potential consequences of carrying personal NN on a device inside their NN ? “ More than the crazy concept , it ’s actually NNS ’s willingness to accept it . That ’s why it ’s crazy to me , ” Rose VBD . “ NNS are just willing to just line up and VB , ‘ Yeah , stick that in me . ’ ” At night , JJ of the convention - goers gathered at a club on Austin ’s Sixth Street . Graafstra was outside with Ryan O’Shea , whose NN Grindhouse Wetware made the Internet squirm earlier this NN when it released a close - up surgery NN of CD of its implants called Northstar . In it , a NN gets a small incision in his hand , and then , with a metallic tool dipped into it , the NN is lifted to produce a cavity where a round subdermal implant with five LED lights is placed . The result looks dystopian — the incision is stitched with black thread , and LED lights make the NN on the hand glow red . But NN hackers view the NN differently , Graafstra VBD . They VBP technology has reached a point where it can improve the JJ NN instead of just fixing what ’s broken . “ A patient MD someday come very soon and say , ‘ My eye is totally fine , but I VBP an eye that can VB infrared . And I VBP an eye that can zoom , ’ ” Graafstra VBD . That kind of future — where the JJ NN is augmented by technology — is the goal of JJ of these experiments . O’Shea VBD Grindhouse Wetware is using its LED device to test how RB a device IN it can remain charged inside a NN , and Graafstra VBD his RFID chip is a small attempt at merging digital identity with physical identity . “ I VBP once NNS realize , ‘ Oh , it ’s OK that my grandma has a pacemaker ’ … NNS are VBG to start to accept this , ” O ’Shea VBD . “ You VBP , the era of transhumanism , I MD say , is here . So let ’s accept that and then VB where that logically takes us . ” Inside the club , a drone hovered above the dance floor . The polished steel and the electronic dance music gave it a futuristic feel . Standing near the bar was Tony Salvador , who studies JJ values and how they affect technology at Intel . He was at the conference to VB a feel of when and if “ NN hacking ” MD be accepted into the mainstream . Sometimes , he VBD , technology moves too fast and outpaces accepted JJ boundaries — not to mention laws . He argued that was part of the reason why early wearers of Google Glass were called “ glassholes . ” “ It created a JJ misunderstanding , ” Salvador VBD . “ You did n’t VB what was VBG on . ” To Salvador , the boundaries of acceptance are a matter of our JJ philosophy , an area that he argued was driven by esoteric discourse without tangible moral and ethical recommendations . The philosophers , he VBD , are letting us down . Alva Noë , a philosopher at the NNP of California , Berkeley and a contributor to NPR ’s 13.7 : Cosmos and Culture blog , has written extensively on what he calls “ cyborgian naturalness . ” He disagreed that the modern philosophers dropped the ball , saying that tackling the matter MD involve unpacking CD questions : • Is it OK to cut into JJ bodies for these kinds of experiments ? • How much tolerance should society have for artificially enhancing the NN ? To the JJ question , Noë VBD he VBD the “ NN hacking ” experimentation on humans “ ethically disturbing ” and MD n’t fathom a NN or any other NNS conducting these kinds of operations . The second question was more complicated . “ We do n’t condemn NNS for using glasses to VB better , ” he VBD . “ But we do start to VB taking speed to cope with your work NN is questionable . ” Because those kinds of judgments are an ethical question , drawing a tolerance line MD always be a moving target , he VBD . “ We MD reach consensuses and then lose them , ” Noë VBD . “ Just as there was once a consensus where it was OK to smoke to function effectively , and now we have the consensus that , increasingly , it ’s not OK to do that . ” If there ’s a rock star in the NN - hacking movement , it ’s Neil Harbisson , a colorblind artist from Barcelona who persuaded a NN to implant a camera in the NN of his head . The antenna , as he calls it , essentially lets Harbisson listen to colors by detecting the dominant color in front of him and translating it into musical notes . The NN he tells it , a medical ethics committee in Europe had refused to sign off on the operation , but a NN agreed to perform the surgery anonymously . From it , Harbisson emerged with a camera connected to a device on the NN of his skull , its lens dangling in front of his face on a rod that arcs over his head . As he walked the streets of Austin , he described how he perceived the NN : the red traffic light sounded IN an A note ; the green grass sounded IN an F . In his keynote address at the conference , Harbisson VBD the JJ NN he heard those colors in his sleep , he felt truly cyborg . Now , he no longer identifies as JJ but as a “ cybernetic organism . ” “ If we define ourselves as organisms , suddenly our group is wider , ” he VBD . “ We are on the same level as an insect , or as a cat , or as a plant . ” Harbisson is well aware of how the NN perceives him . He moved from Barcelona to NNP York City in search of “ peace ” with another friend in the transhumanist movement , Moon Ribas . Ribas has an electronic device in her arm that she VBD vibrates when there is an earthquake anywhere in the NN . On more than CD occasion , NNS have tried to rip off his antenna , Harbisson VBD . That ’s part of the reason why he co-founded the Cyborg Foundation to advocate for “ cyborg rights . ” When asked if he ’s ever thought about just taking the antenna off , Harbisson demurred . “ To me , it ’s much stronger , the wish to sense what ’s around me , than the fact that NNS keep annoying me , ” he VBD , adding that maybe , in the future , as others VBP JJ senses , he ’ll be considered normal .
